0.title: Don't share photocopy of Aadhaar card as it can be misused: Govt's advisory
0.article_body: The Centre has issued a new advisory warning people to not share the photocopy of their Aadhaar cards with any organisation as it can be misused. It further asked the public to use masked copies of the Aadhaar. Organisations that have obtained a user license from the UIDAI can use Aadhaar for establishing the identity of a person, it added.

1.title: Anurag Thakur not worthy of even being councillor: AAP leader
1.article_body: AAP's Naresh Balyan said Union Minister Anurag Thakur is in politics because of his father, otherwise "he isn't worthy of even being a councillor". His remark came in reaction to Thakur's comment on the Delhi stadium row in which an IAS couple was accused of using the Delhi government-run stadium for walking their dog. "Delhi government did nothing," Thakur said.

2.title: Judges' innerwear is saffron: PFI leader after HC's order on Kerala rally
2.article_body: PFI leader Yahiya Thangal reacted to Kerala High Court ordering police to take action against the party over hate sloganeering at Alappuzha rally, saying that judges are "shocked" by the slogans. The reason for the shock is that judges' "innerwear is saffron", he claimed. A purported video of the rally showed a minor boy raising slogans against Hindus and Christians.

3.title: India not Modi-Shah's, formed as people migrated from Africa, Iran: Owaisi
3.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said India was formed after people migrated from Africa, Iran, Central Asia and East Asia. "India is neither mine, nor Thackeray's, nor Modi-Shah's. If India belongs to anyone, it's Dravidians and Adivasis," he added. "I believe Mughals are responsible for rising petrol prices...Prime Minister is not responsible for anything," Owaisi had earlier said.

4.title: France, Germany ask Putin to release 2,500 Ukrainian prisoners
4.article_body: French President Emmanuel Macron and German Chancellor Olaf Scholz reportedly asked Russian President Vladimir Putin to release 2,500 Ukrainian soldiers who were taken as prisoners at Mariupol's Azovstal steel plant. Russia earlier said that around 2,000 Ukrainian soldiers surrendered in Mariupol. The two European leaders persuaded Putin to meet Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy directly.

5.title: In memory of Shane Warne, I hope RR go out there and smash GT: Akhtar
5.article_body: Ex-Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar has said RR should defeat GT in the IPL 2022 final as a tribute to their ex-captain Shane Warne, who passed away in March this year. Akhtar, however, also added that he wanted one of the new teams to win this season. "Heart says, 'RR win it for Warne'...[but] I will go with GT," he stated.

6.title: 'American Graffiti' star Bo Hopkins passes away after suffering heart attack
6.article_body: American actor Bo Hopkins, who appeared in films like 'American Graffiti', 'The Wild Bunch' and  'Midnight Express', has passed away. The actor, who was in his 80s, died at a hospital in Los Angeles after suffering a heart attack on May 9, his wife Sian told The Hollywood Reporter. Prior to acting, Hopkins had served in the US Army.

7.title: US becomes India's biggest trading partner in 2021-22, surpasses China
7.article_body: The US has surpassed China to become India's biggest trading partner in 2021-2022, according to the data by the Ministry of Commerce and Industry. Bilateral trade between India and the US stood at $119.42 billion in 2021-2022 in contrast to $80.51 billion in 2020-21. Meanwhile, bilateral trade between India and China stood at $115.42 billion in 2021-2022.

8.title: Aamir Khan's sister Nikhat Khan to make her TV debut with 'Banni Chow Home Delivery'
8.article_body: Aamir Khan's sister Nikhat Khan will make her TV debut with the show 'Banni Chow Home Delivery'. "I'm excited to make my debut on the small screen...It’s an opportunity and an honour to make my place in the viewers' heart," she said. Nikhat has worked in several films and has also produced films and shows.

9.title: Sanju Samson's wife trolls IPL broadcasters over animated IPL race video
9.article_body: Sanju Samson's wife Charulatha took to her Instagram Stories to troll IPL broadcasters over an animated IPL race video. "Saw this animated video showing the race for IPL 2022 on the first day of IPL...And wondered why there wasn't any pink jersey," she wrote. RR will face GT in IPL 2022 final tonight.

10.title: Had Cong accepted Savarkar's words, partition wouldn't have happened: Yogi
10.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath has claimed that if the then Congress party had listened to VD Savarkar's words then India would have been saved from partition. "Veer Savarkar was never given the honour he deserved...He did not even get his ancestral property till 1960. The word 'Hindutva' was coined by Savarkar," said CM Yogi while releasing a book on Savarkar.

11.title: 1 killed, 4 injured after blast in boiler factory in Uttar Pradesh
11.article_body: One person was killed while four others were reportedly injured in a blast that took place at the Frontier Springs Company located in Rania of Akbarpur Kotwali area in Uttar Pradesh. The Station House Officer (SHO) of Akbarpur said that all those injured in the blast were admitted to the hospital.

12.title: Vicky, Kartik, Kriti attend Dinesh Vijan's sister's reception, pics surface
12.article_body: Several celebrities, including Vicky Kaushal, Kartik Aaryan and Kriti Sanon, attended the wedding reception of Pooja Vijan, sister of filmmaker Dinesh Vijan, on Saturday in Mumbai. Bhushan Kumar, Manish Malhotra, Sunny Kaushal and Diana Penty were also among the celebrities who attended the reception at the Taj Mahal Palace, Colaba. Pooja recently tied the knot with Manjot in Mumbai.

13.title: GT will have slight edge over RR in the IPL 2022 final: Suresh Raina
13.article_body: Ahead of the IPL 2022 final, Suresh Raina said Gujarat Titans have a "slight edge over" Rajasthan Royals. "[This is] because GT have had a good rest of four-five days and also due to the tempo they've been in this season," he added. However, Raina stated that RR cannot be taken lightly as they have been in "sublime form".

14.title: Guj man kills self over alleged torture in police custody; 5 booked
14.article_body: Four police officers and a diamond factory owner were booked after the factory's manager allegedly died by suicide in Gujarat's Surat. The deceased's brother filed a complaint claiming that man was tortured by the police and factory owner, who'd accused him of theft. The deceased had been the factory's manager for over 18 months. "We've...started the probe," an inspector said.

15.title: Tara Air flight carrying 22 people including 4 Indians goes missing over Nepal
15.article_body: Tara Air's 9 NAET twin-engine aircraft carrying 22 passengers including the crew has lost contact over Nepal, airport authorities said. The missing aircraft was hosting four Indian and three Japanese nationals and the remaining were Nepali citizens, ANI said. The aircraft was flying from Pokhara to Jomsom at 9:55 am, according to airport authorities.

16.title: Tata Motors gets Gujarat govt's approval to take over Ford's Sanand plant
16.article_body: Months after Ford Motor Company announced its exit from India, Tata Motors has received an approval from the Gujarat cabinet to take over the former's passenger car manufacturing plant in Sanand. The plant had ceased operations in April this year after Ford ended its manufacturing in India owing to "huge accumulated losses" and lack of growth in the market.

17.title: Heavy rains, landslides kill 34 in Brazil; red alert issued
17.article_body: At least 34 people have been reportedly killed in the last few days due to heavy rains and landslides in Brazil's Pernambuco state. The National Institute of Meteorology has issued a red alert for Sunday in the state. Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro expressed anguish over the deaths and announced a relief of one billion Brazilian real.

18.title: Delhi benefited from his work: Maneka Gandhi on IAS officer's transfer
18.article_body: Commenting on IAS officer couple Sanjeev Khirwar and Rinku Dugga's transfer to Ladakh and Arunachal Pradesh respectively, BJP's Maneka Gandhi said the allegation against them of abusing their power is false. "When Khirwar was secretary of the environment department, Delhi benefited from his work," Gandhi added. "I know Sanjeev Khirwar very well. The allegations against him are false," she stated.

19.title: B'wood celebs should stop pretending to like each other: Abhay Deol
19.article_body: Actor Abhay Deol was asked what Bollywood celebrities should stop pretending about. To this, the actor replied that they should stop pretending to like each other. He added, "I am being facetious here!" He was later asked to name one thing that is unfair in the film industry. To this, Abhay replied, "Endorsing fairness creams."

20.title: Elephant carries dead calf in its trunk for over 7 km in West Bengal, video surfaces
20.article_body: A video of an elephant carrying its dead calf in its trunk in West Bengal has surfaced on social media. The video showed how the elephant struggled to hold the dead calf in its trunk in a tea garden. According to an officer, the herd of 30-35 elephants travelled over 7 km from one garden to another with that calf.

21.title: I'm 100% sure that Buttler will score big in IPL 2022 final: Manjrekar
21.article_body: Commentator Sanjay Manjrekar has said RR opener Jos Buttler, who's currently the highest run-getter of IPL 2022, will score big against GT in the tournament's final on Sunday. "Buttler singlehandedly won RR the game against RCB...and GT will need to do something to stop him," added Manjrekar. Buttler has scored 824 runs in the season so far.

22.title: Govt officer says 'well went missing' in K'taka village; FIR filed
22.article_body: An FIR has been registered after a Panchayat Development Officer filed a complaint claiming that a well made for the public in Narikombu gram panchayat limits in Karnataka's Dakshina Kannada has gone missing, police said. According to the complainant, a panchayat member had allegedly illegally closed the well and grabbed the land. A sub-inspector said that the case was "perplexing".

23.title: Strange to be able to sleep on bed after sleeping on ground for 6 yrs: Indrani Mukerjea
23.article_body: After spending nearly seven years in prison in her daughter Sheena Bora's murder case, former media executive Indrani Mukerjea, who was recently released on bail, said, "It was strange to be able to sleep on a bed after sleeping on the ground for six years." She added, "I was put through a massive media trial which was very hurtful."

24.title: Who won what at Cannes Film Festival 2022 as Indian film bags top documentary award?
24.article_body: Swedish film 'Triangle of Sadness' won the Palme d'Or, the top prize at the Cannes Film Festival 2022. Park Chan-wook won the best director award for 'Decision to Leave', while Song Kang Ho and Zar Amir Ebrahimi won the best actor and best actress award, respectively. Indian documentary 'All That Breathes' won the L'Oeil d'Or award.

25.title: We're just waiting to find new Kapil Sharma: Archana on 'India's...'
25.article_body: Archana Puran Singh, speaking about her upcoming show 'India's Laughter Champion', said, "We're just waiting to find a new Kapil Sharma...a new Krushna (Abhishek) as well." Archana added that she and Shekhar Suman will be getting together after a long time. "Shekhar is a friend and a colleague. He's very talented as far as his comedy is concerned," she said.

26.title: I accidentally punched Ronit & broke his nose, was s**t scared: Rajat on Udaan
26.article_body: Rajat Barmecha, speaking about the climax of his debut movie 'Udaan', revealed that he accidentally punched Ronit Roy and broke his nose while shooting for the scene. "You can imagine how tough it'd be for a new actor, in front of Ronit, who was so...established. I was s**t scared," Rajat said, adding, "I also thought he'd...punch me...But everyone...took him to...hospital."

27.title: 3 arrested over bike stunts in Noida; video surfaces
27.article_body: A man, along with his two friends, was arrested in Noida after a video showing him perform a bike stunt surfaced on social media, said police. The video showed the accused, Vikas, riding a motorcycle lying flat on the vehicle while 'Shaktimaan' tune, from the popular TV show, played in the background. His two friends allegedly filmed the act.

28.title: Heartbeat was normal, I was prepared for game to go down to wire: Harmanpreet
28.article_body: After winning the Women's T20 Challenge 2022 by four runs, Supernovas captain Harmanpreet Kaur said she was ready for the game to go down the wire. "My heartbeat was normal. I knew this game was going to be like that only," she stated. Deepti Sharma-led Velocity needed 17 to win in the final over but could only score 12 runs.

29.title: Avoid strange links: UP Police uses 'Stranger Things' reference to warn people
29.article_body: UP Police on Saturday used Netflix's sci-fi series 'Stranger Things' reference to warn people against clicking on "stranger links", that they are not familiar with, in order to stay safe from cybercrime activities. "Clicking on 'stranger links' may lead to #StrangerThings," UP Police tweeted. "Never open links which contain Stranger Things," UP Police added.

30.title: Stone pelting in Guj over groom riding mare, 8 police personnel injured; 70 held
30.article_body: Police arrested 70 people after a mob pelted stones at a wedding procession in Gujarat, injuring several people, including eight police personnel. The mob objected to the groom, belonging to Other Backward Class(OBC) community, riding a mare. Police said the groom had demanded police security. A police inspector said that he was assaulted with a stick by an accused.

31.title: Annoyed by bark, man shoots neighbour's dog in Jewar
31.article_body: A man allegedly shot at his neighbour's pet dog as he was annoyed by its bark in UP's Jewar. The man, identified as Monu, has been booked under IPC Section 429 (mischief by killing or maiming an animal) and 506 (criminal intimidation). The dog was taken to a vet clinic for treatment, while the accused is on the run.

32.title: India reports 2,828 new COVID-19 cases, 14 deaths in last 24 hours
32.article_body: India has reported 2,828 COVID-19 cases, 2,035 recoveries and 14 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 2,685 COVID-19 cases and 33 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 17,087, while the death toll has risen to 5,24,586.

33.title: Pak says it is open to buying oil from Russia, says 'We have an open policy'
33.article_body: Amid Western sanctions on Russia, Pakistan has said that it is open to importing oil and wheat from the country. "Our policy is clear....in terms of expanding economic and trade relations, we have an open policy, driven by national interest. Wherever we see there is a national benefit, we pursue those options and avenues," said Pakistan's Foreign Office spokesperson.

34.title: Oil India records highest-ever quarterly profit due to high fuel, gas prices
34.article_body: Government-owned Oil India Limited (OIL) recorded a net profit of ₹3,887.31 crore for the year that ended on March 2022, its highest-ever quarterly net profit. The net profit is 123.20% higher when compared with the ₹1741.59 crore profit reported last year. One of the reasons behind the record profit is high crude oil and gas prices, said OIL's top executive.

35.title: BJP, RSS only after Mughals: Asaduddin Owaisi
35.article_body: Addressing a rally in Maharashtra's Bhiwandi, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi has criticised the BJP and RSS. "If India belongs to anyone, it's Dravidians and Adivasis but BJP-RSS are only after Mughals," Owaisi said. "BJP, NCP, Congress...are the secular parties. They think that they shouldn't go to jail but it is okay if some Muslim party member goes," he added.

36.title: Rhea Chakraborty's lawyer seeks reopening of NCB probe into drug case
36.article_body: The advocate for Rhea Chakraborty, who was arrested on drug-related charges in 2020, has sought a re-opening of the investigation by the NCB (Mumbai zone). Satish Maneshinde, the lawyer who also represented Aryan Khan, who was the given clean chit in cruise drugs case, said many such "Bollywood youngsters" had been summoned by the NCB but "nobody knows for what".

37.title: Kartik's 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' becomes 5th Hindi film to cross ₹100-crore mark in 2022
37.article_body: Kartik Aaryan-starrer 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' has become the fifth Hindi film to cross the ₹100-crore mark in 2022. The film crossed the milestone on the ninth day of its release.  Earlier, Alia Bhatt's 'Gangubai Kathiawadi', Anupam Kher's 'The Kashmir Files', Ram Charan's 'RRR' (Hindi) and Yash's 'KGF 2' (Hindi) have achieved the feat.

38.title: If Yashasvi wants to play for India, he'll have to score big runs: Sehwag
38.article_body: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag has said RR opener Yashasvi Jaiswal needs to convert his starts into big innings if he wants to play for Team India. "Undoubtedly, his 21(13) was very useful against RCB...[but] if he has to play for India, he'll have to score big runs. He'll have to show that he is hungry for big scores," stated Sehwag.

39.title: Who wants to stay with Congress? Many ready to quit: BJP's CT Ravi
39.article_body: BJP leader CT Ravi on Saturday said that many Congress leaders are ready to quit the party. "They (Opposition MLAs) are constantly in touch (with BJP). Who wants to stay with Congress? Many are ready to quit, not just in Goa but across the country," Ravi added. "We have seen Hardik Patel and Sunil Jakhar quitting Congress," Ravi stated.

40.title: Pic of Akshay from set surfaces online, fans call it 1st look from Soorarai Pottru remake
40.article_body: A picture of Akshay Kumar apparently from the sets of a film has been leaked online. Fans have claimed that it is Akshay's look from his upcoming Hindi remake of 'Soorarai Pottru'. "He is looking rich even in this look," a fan commented. Last month, Akshay had announced that he has started filming for the film.

41.title: Good cinema has to be seen by everyone: Sonu Sood on pan-India films
41.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood, speaking about the recent success of South Indian films across the country, said, "I always believed...that good cinema has to be seen by everyone." He added that language should not be a barrier in films. "Now with South movies doing so well, and Hindi movies getting dubbed in South...conveys...that entertainment has to reach every house," Sonu said.

42.title: Always liked a challenge: Manushi on working with Akshay, YRF for 1st time
42.article_body: Manushi Chhillar, who'll make her debut with 'Samrat Prithviraj', spoke about working with Akshay Kumar and Yash Raj Films (YRF) for the first time. "They...know the kind of challenges you're facing. They...kind of make it a little comfortable for you, but I've always liked a challenge in life," she said. Manushi will be seen portraying Princess Sanyogita in the film.

43.title: Kerala govt has lenient view against terrorist activities: V Muraleedharan
43.article_body: Union Minister V Muraleedharan on Saturday said that the Kerala government has a "lenient view" against terrorist activities and groups. His remark came after a video of a minor boy raising provocative slogans during a PFI rally in Kerala went viral. "Such things happen in Kerala repeatedly because of covert support of the government in power," Muraleedharan added.

44.title: Industrialist caught red-handed while receiving cocaine in B'luru
44.article_body: Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) has arrested an industrialist, Adi Srinivas Naidu, after he was caught red-handed while receiving cocaine near Sadahalli Gate on way to Kempegowda International Airport, officials said. The arrest was made earlier this week. NCB also raided Naidu's house in the city but no drugs were found. Naidu's family runs Mallya Hospital and other places in Bengaluru.

45.title: Pune civic body demolishes dilapidated 'wadas' ahead of monsoon
45.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has started a demolition drive against dilapidated 'wadas' (old structures) owing to safety concerns ahead of the monsoon season. The civic body has razed 14 'wadas' and sent notices for another 245 structures, calling them unstable and risky to stay. "Any untoward incident can happen if prompt action is not taken," said an official.

46.title: Politicians must respect each other, we're not enemies: Vice President
46.article_body: Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu on Saturday said that in public life, politicians must respect each other. "We are not enemies but we are only political rivals," Naidu added. "This is my advice to modern politicians, you may belong to this party or that party but we all belong to this great country," Naidu stated.

47.title: Hyd Police help woman who fell due to sunstroke, offer food; share pic
47.article_body: Hyderabad Police took to Twitter to share a picture of a woman who reportedly fell due to a sunstroke. "WPC [Woman Police Constable] Priyanka of Karkhana [police station] took her to [police station] and offered her water [and] food. The old lady was touched by this gesture and blessed the staff. SHO Karkhana appreciated Priyanka for her kindness," police wrote.

48.title: Extremely rare event: Ather Energy issues statement after fire at EV dealership
48.article_body: Electric vehicle manufacturer Ather Energy issued a statement after a fire broke out at their Chennai dealership and led to a loss of some property and EV scooters. It said that it was an "extremely rare" incident which was caused after a high-pressure wash on a vehicle that had undergone an accident led to water entering its battery pack.

49.title: It's been a frustrating tournament personally, but I like big games: Wade
49.article_body: Ahead of the IPL 2022 final against RR, GT's Matthew Wade, who has scored 149 runs in nine games, said the tournament has been frustrating for him but he likes to perform in the "big games". He added, "I've really enjoyed...being able to turn a couple of performances on in finals, and hopefully I can do that [against RR]."

50.title: Woman killed, husband injured after speeding car hits them in Pune
50.article_body: A 60-year-old woman was killed and her 63-year-old husband injured after a speeding car reportedly hit them in Pune on Friday. The couple were said to be walking when the car struck them from behind. The victims' 32-year-old son lodged a complaint with the police, after which the car driver was arrested for rash and negligent driving.

51.title: Driver held after 16-yr-old girl dies as school bus hits bike in B'luru
51.article_body: The driver of a school bus was arrested for ramming the bus into a bike and running over a 16-year-old girl in Bengaluru. Reports said that while the deceased girl's sister and friend landed on roadside with minor injuries after being flung into air, the deceased landed on the road and was run over by the bus.

52.title: Man, mother held for murder of brother-in-law in Gurugram
52.article_body: A man and his mother were held in connection with the murder of the former's brother-in-law in Gurugram's DLF Phase 3 area. The man, identified as Suraj Rai, is accused of killing the victim, Shubhankar Bhadra, while the woman, Malti Rai, is accused of misleading the police. The incident happened due to an argument over stock market losses, police said.

53.title: Car catches fire on Pune-Mumbai Expressway; 7 women escape unhurt
53.article_body: A car's seven female passengers were able to escape unhurt after the vehicle caught on fire at Bhor Ghat on Pune-Mumbai Expressway, police officials said on Saturday. The occupants got out and moved to a safe distance from the car after driver noticed smoke coming out of the bonnet, according to police. An elderly woman was also brought out safely.

54.title: Pilot observes cracks in SpiceJet flight's windshield mid-air, flies it back to Mumbai
54.article_body: A SpiceJet plane, which was scheduled to land in Gorakhpur in Uttar Pradesh, went back to Mumbai on Saturday after its pilot observed cracks on the windshield, according to an official statement. The air traffic controller was apprised and the aircraft landed safely at the Mumbai airport, a spokesperson said.

55.title: I begged Dilip Kumar to work with me in 'Thevar...' remake: Haasan
55.article_body: Actor Kamal Haasan recalled an incident when he asked late actor Dilip Kumar to work with him in the Hindi remake of 'Thevar Magan'. "I really held Dilip saab's hand and begged him, but he had decided not to act," he stated. Haasan added, "It didn't happen so I gave it to another friend...he made it with Anil Kapoor...Amrish Puri."

56.title: Deepika was furious, asked 'You'll hug me like this?': Ranveer on 'Bajirao...'
56.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh said he first hugged wife and actress Deepika Padukone in front of the camera while they were promoting their film 'Bajirao Mastani'. "She was furious, she asked me 'you'll hug me like this in front of the camera?'" Ranveer recalled. He added that even though it has been 10 years with Deepika, she continues to surprise him.

57.title: What have been the highest and lowest totals scored in finals in IPL history?
57.article_body: SRH hold the record for scoring the highest total in an IPL final. SRH put up 208 runs in 2016 final and went on to win against RCB by 8 runs. CSK scored 205/5 in 2011 final and beat RCB by 58 runs. CSK's 125/9 in their 23-run defeat against MI in IPL 2013 is the lowest IPL final total.

58.title: India's success with vaccination drive offers lessons for world: Bill Gates
58.article_body: Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates appreciated India's COVID-19 vaccination drive after meeting Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya at the World Economic Forum. Gates tweeted, "It was great to meet...Mansukh Mandaviya and exchange perspectives on global health. India's success with the vaccination drive and the use of technology to drive health outcomes at scale offers many lessons for the world."

59.title: What are the highest individual scores in the history of IPL finals?
59.article_body: Shane Watson holds the record for the highest individual score in an IPL final. The then CSK all-rounder scored 117*(57) against SRH in IPL 2018 final. He's followed by Wriddhiman Saha, who scored 115*(55) for PBKS against KKR in IPL 2014 final. Murali Vijay's 95(52) for CSK against RCB in IPL 2011 final is third-highest score in an IPL final.

60.title: 1,500-year-old city with palaces, pyramids found in Mexico; pics released
60.article_body: The remains of a 1,500-year-old city have been found by archaeologists in the Yucatan region of Mexico. The Mayan city of Xiol (meaning 'the spirit of man') is believed to have been the home of some 4,000 people between 600 and 900 CE. An array of palaces, pyramids and plazas have also been found at the site.

61.title: Real Madrid defeat Liverpool to win Champions League for a record-extending 14th time
61.article_body: Real Madrid defeated Liverpool 1-0 at the Stade de France in Saint-Denis in a repeat of the 2018 Champions League final to win the Champions League/European Cup for a record-extending 14th time. It is Real Madrid's fourth Champions League victory in seven seasons. Six-time champions Liverpool have now finished runners-up in the competition for the fourth time.

62.title: Harmanpreet Kaur-led Supernovas defeat Velocity to win Women's T20 Challenge for 3rd time
62.article_body: Harmanpreet Kaur-led Supernovas defeated Deepti Sharma-led Velocity by four runs in the final to win the Women's T20 Challenge for the third time. Deandra Dottin's 62(44) and Harmanpreet's 43(29) helped Supernovas put up a total of 165/7. Velocity were restricted to 161/8 in their 20 overs, with Alana King and Sophie Ecclestone taking three and two wickets, respectively.

63.title: India's only official entry at Cannes wins top documentary award
63.article_body: Indian documentary 'All That Breathes', which was India's only official entry at the 2022 Cannes Film Festival, has won the top documentary award L'Oeil d'Or. It is based on two brothers who take the initiative to save birds amid the rise of pollution. The film earlier won the World Cinema Grand Jury Prize: Documentary at the 2022 Sundance Film Festival.

64.title: If you're leading a team in IPL, you can lead India: Manjrekar on Hardik
64.article_body: Speaking about GT skipper Hardik Pandya, commentator Sanjay Manjrekar stated, "If you are leading a team in the IPL, you can lead Team India." He added, "Hardik showed us how comfortable he looked in a leadership role captaining GT." Hardik led his side to IPL final in their debut season. GT will play against RR in the final on Sunday.

65.title: Had some tough moments with injuries in my career: Nadal on 301 Slam wins
65.article_body: After achieving 301 Grand Slam wins, 21-time Grand Slam champion Rafael Nadal said he's "very happy" about how things have been during his tennis career despite having some tough moments with injuries. "But at...same time because of tennis, I enjoyed many experiences," he added. Nadal achieved this feat after defeating Botic van de Zandschulp in 2022 French Open third round.

66.title: Ireland reports first confirmed monkeypox case
66.article_body: Ireland has confirmed its first case of monkeypox, the Health Service Executive (HSE) said in a statement on Saturday. A separate suspected case is also being investigated and test results are awaited, the country's health agency added. This was not unexpected following the presence of monkeypox cases in the UK and many European countries, it further said.

67.title: World's biggest coal miner Coal India to import for first time since 2015: Report
67.article_body: World's biggest coal miner Coal India will import coal for the first time since 2015 amid shortages, Reuters reported. "Coal India would import coal for blending on government-to-government...basis and supply...to thermal power plants of state generators and independent power producers," a letter by the Power Ministry said. This comes as India faces its worst power cuts in over six years.

68.title: Govt employees skipping poll duty in MP's Rewa will be retired: DM
68.article_body: The District Magistrate in Madhya Pradesh's Rewa has directed that government employees who are unavailable for panchayat election duty will be retired prematurely. An official circular was issued after some government officials and employees posted in Rewa expressed their inability to be available for election duty. The three-tier panchayat elections will be held from June 25 to July 8.

69.title: The trend of 'Bollywood khatam' will never happen: Rohit on B'wood vs South cinema debate
69.article_body: Rohit Shetty, commenting on the debate between South and Hindi cinema, said Bollywood will stay unaffected, while adding that southern films have been remade since the 60s. "The trend of 'Bollywood khatam' will never happen. In the 80s, when VCRs came, people said theatre will go out of business...With...boom of OTT, many people said that Bollywood is finished," he added.

70.title: US shooter sent rape threats to women, talked about shooting up schools online
70.article_body: Salvador Ramos, the 18-year-old who killed 21 people at an elementary school in US' Texas before being gunned down, had threatened women and girls with rape on a social media app, reports said. In the weeks leading up to the Texas shooting, Ramos had reportedly also threatened to shoot up schools and showed off weapons during livestreams on the app.

71.title: Aamir eats pani puri ahead of 'Laal...' trailer preview, pics viral
71.article_body: Pictures and videos of actor Aamir Khan eating pani puri ahead of the preview of the 'Laal Singh Chaddha' trailer have gone viral on social media. A video shows Aamir interacting with fans and appreciating the vendor for the pani puri. The trailer of the film will be launched during the first innings and second time-out of the IPL finale.

72.title: Over half of Afghanistan's population is dependent on aid: UN
72.article_body: More than half of Afghanistan's population is dependent on humanitarian assistance, according to the United Nations High Commission for Refugees (UNHCR). "One in two people in Afghanistan do not know where their next meal is coming from," it said. However, the Taliban government has denied the claims made by UNHCR and said that poverty has been declining in Afghanistan.

73.title: Bopanna-Middelkoop beat 2nd seeds Mektic-Pavic to reach French Open quarters
73.article_body: India's Rohan Bopanna and his Dutch partner Matwe Middelkoop saved five match points to knock out second seeds Mate Pavic and Nikola Mektic in the men's doubles third round at the French Open on Saturday. The 16th seeds defeated the reigning Wimbledon champions 6-7(5-7), 7-6(7-3), 7-6(12-10) in two hours 32 minutes to enter the quarter-finals.

74.title: 7 trekkers go missing in U'khand, SDRF sends chopper for rescue
74.article_body: Seven trekkers have gone missing on Pandav Shera route in Uttarakhand's Rudraprayag at a height of around 4,500 metres. The State Disaster Response Force (SDRF) on Saturday sent a high-altitude rescue team and a chopper to the area to launch a search and rescue operation. "Their last message...was that they were...injured and without any food or water," an official said.

75.title: Ukraine's ex-Prez Petro Poroshenko blocked from leaving the country
75.article_body: Ukraine's former President Petro Poroshenko was prevented from leaving the country to take part in a meeting of a NATO body in Lithuania. Poroshenko could not leave due to "technical problems" with a permit, according to the Ukrainian media. Notably, Poroshenko is being investigated for treason in a probe he has described as a politically motivated attack.

76.title: AAP govt has eliminated illegal sand mining from Punjab: Minister
76.article_body: Punjab Mining Minister HS Bains has said the AAP government has eliminated illegal sand mining from the state. He said that legal mining has increased, adding, "Last year, 35,000-40,000 MT of extraction used to happen daily...now it has crossed one lakh MT." Earlier, Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann had said that a new comprehensive pro-people sand mining policy will be framed.

77.title: Video of Bihar girl with 4 arms and legs surfaces, Sonu Sood says 'Treatment started'
77.article_body: Recently, a video of a 2.5-year-old girl from Bihar with 4 arms and legs surfaced online. According to reports, the girl has 4 arms and legs since birth and her parents do not have money for treatment. Reacting to the video, actor Sonu Sood shared a picture and tweeted, "Treatment has been started. Just pray."

78.title: Krishna, McCoy kept RCB under pressure: Tendulkar on RR's Qualifier 2 win
78.article_body: Sachin Tendulkar has said RR's key bowlers Prasidh Krishna and Obed McCoy kept RCB under pressure to help their side win Qualifier 2 by seven wickets in Ahmedabad to enter the final on Friday. "[RCB's] 157 wasn't a good total at all on this surface," he added. Krishna registered bowling figures of 4-0-22-3 while McCoy posted 4-0-23-3 in the match.

79.title: Woman poisons her 3 children, later attempts suicide in Kolkata
79.article_body: A woman poisoned her three children and later attempted suicide in Kolkata. While her two daughters lost their lives, the woman and her son are currently said to be in a critical condition. Local residents claimed she used to complain that her husband had stopped sending her money, due to which she was unable to bear expenses for basic needs.

80.title: Assam Uber driver tries to run over customer over payment, arrested
80.article_body: An Uber driver was arrested in Assam's Guwahati on Saturday for allegedly abusing two journalists and assaulting one of them over a payment method dispute. The journalists had opted for an online payment, while the driver wanted the payment in cash. Nikita Jain, one of the journalists, claimed the driver also tried to run her colleague over with his car.

81.title: Indian films succeeding better than H'wood films succeeding: Kamal
81.article_body: Veteran actor Kamal Haasan has stated that when a film does well, it is not a South film succeeding but an Indian film succeeding, adding that is always better than a Hollywood film succeeding. He further said, "'Mughal-E-Azam', 'Sholay'...many others have seen national [success]. 'Mughal-E-Azam' is not just intelligence, it's guts...We should respect each other. Films don't have a language."

82.title: 50% of rural households have access to tap water connections: Govt
82.article_body: India has achieved the milestone of 50% of rural households having access to tap water connections, Jal Shakti Ministry said on Saturday. Over 9.59 crore rural households across the country are getting water within their premises, it added. Notably, Goa, Telangana, Andaman and Nicobar Islands, Dadra and Nagar Haveli, Daman and Diu, Puducherry and Haryana have achieved 100% household connections.

83.title: BJP is attacking democracy, socialism & secularism: Akhilesh Yadav
83.article_body: Samajwadi Party (SP) chief Akhilesh Yadav on Saturday accused the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) of "destroying" socialism, secularism and democracy in the country. "BJP still needs to understand socialism. This time the fight is not only about saving the state but also saving democracy, socialism and secularism," he said. "BJP is attacking these and destroying institutions," the SP chief added.

84.title: Who is 18-year-old Sriya Lenka, the first Indian K-pop star?
84.article_body: Sriya Lenka, the 18-year-old Indian who is the newest entrant in the K-pop girl group Blackswan, is a native of Odisha's Rourkela. Lenka, who's India's first K-pop star, is reportedly a trained Odissi classical singer and dancer. She started auditioning to join K-pop groups during the 2020 lockdown. She trained in rap, musical instruments etc in Seoul before joining Blackswan.

85.title: Govt turning blind eye to Muslims' hardships: Jamiat Ulama-i-Hind
85.article_body: Muslim organisation Jamiat Ulama-i-Hind on Saturday said that the country is "burning" in the fire of religious animosity and hatred. Its chief Maulana Mahmood Asad Madani said that the government had turned a blind eye to the hardships that Muslims in the country were facing. "We will bear every torture but will not let anyone dismember our country," Madani added.

86.title: Massive fire breaks out on £6 million superyacht in UK, video surfaces
86.article_body: A massive blaze was reported on a superyacht worth £6 million (around ₹59 crore) in the UK's Torquay, with a video showing the skies covered in black smoke. The fire broke out on the 85-foot superyacht that was anchored in the town's harbour. The town's seafront has been cordoned off and the beach has been evacuated.

87.title: CBFC makes 4 changes in 'Samrat Prithviraj', adds disclaimer on Sati
87.article_body: The CBFC has passed Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Samrat Prithviraj' with a U/A certificate after suggesting four modifications in the dialogue. These include changing 'haran' to 'waran', 'nana' to 'sage', 'kabza' to 'hamla' and 'antim' to 'mahan'. The board has also asked for the addition of a disclaimer which states that the filmmakers do not encourage the act of Johar or Sati.

88.title: World no. 1 Swiatek records 31st straight win to make last 16 at French Open
88.article_body: World number one Iga Swiatek registered her 31st consecutive win after defeating unseeded Danka Kovinic 6-3, 7-5 in women's singles third round at French Open on Saturday. The 2020 champion has now reached the fourth round in all four of her Roland Garros appearances. Meanwhile, second-seeded Daniil Medvedev defeated Miomir Kecmanovic 6-2, 6-4, 6-2 to enter men's singles fourth round.

89.title: Father of Kerala boy accused of hate speech at PFI rally detained
89.article_body: The father of a minor boy, who allegedly raised provocative slogans at a rally of the Popular Front of India (PFI) in Kerala recently, has been detained. The boy's father claimed his son had learned the slogans at earlier PFI programmes. "We didn't intend to target any religion," he added. Twenty people have been arrested so far in the case.

90.title: Mizoram records lowest infant mortality rate for 2nd straight year
90.article_body: Mizoram has reported the lowest infant mortality rate (IMR) in the country for the second consecutive year, according to official data. Mizoram recorded three deaths per 1000 live births, the data showed. Among the northeastern states, Assam has the highest infant mortality rate of 36, followed by Meghalaya at 29 and Arunachal Pradesh at 21.

91.title: Kedarnath yatra halted for a day due to heavy rush of pilgrims
91.article_body: Pilgrimage to the Kedarnath Temple in Uttarakhand was halted in Sonprayag around 10 am on Saturday due to a heavy rush of devotees, Rudraprayag Circle Officer Pramod Kumar said. The yatra will now resume at 4 am on Sunday, Kumar added. Earlier this week, the Kedarnath yatra was stopped due to snowfall and bad weather.

92.title: AAP nominates 2 Padma Shri awardees for Rajya Sabha from Punjab
92.article_body: The Punjab unit of Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Saturday nominated environmentalist Balbir Singh Seechewal and entrepreneur, philanthropist and social activist Vikramjit Singh Sahney as its candidates for Rajya Sabha seats from the state. Notably, both the nominees are Padma Shri awardees. The biennial elections to 57 Rajya Sabha seats will be held on June 10.

93.title: Stampede for food kills 31, including children, at church in Nigeria
93.article_body: At least 31 people, including children, have been killed and several injured during a stampede at a church event in southern Nigeria's Port Harcourt city, a police spokesperson said. Hundreds of people who turned up to receive food at the church broke through a gate, causing the stampede, the spokesperson added. "Some got impatient and started rushing," the statement said.

94.title: 2 Hizbul Mujahideen terrorists killed by security forces in J&K
94.article_body: Two terrorists affiliated with the terror outfit Hizbul Mujahideen were killed in an encounter with security forces in J&K's Anantnag district on Saturday, police said. The duo, identified as Ishfaq Ah Ganie and Yawar Ayub Dar, were involved in several terror crimes, IGP Kashmir Vijay Kumar said. Police have recovered incriminating materials, including arms and ammunition, from their possession.

95.title: Iran showcases underground drone base amid tensions with US, Greece
95.article_body: Iran has showcased an underground base for its military drones on the state media on Saturday. However, the location of the facility that is a host to 100 drones wasn't revealed. Notably, this comes after Iran seized two Greek tankers in an apparent retaliation for the confiscation of Iranian oil by the US from a tanker held off Greece.

96.title: His arrest was unjustified, it's a dark chapter: Aryan's lawyers
96.article_body: After Shah Rukh Khan's son Aryan Khan was given a clean chit by NCB in the Mumbai cruise drugs case, his lawyers Satish Maneshinde and Mukul Rohatgi have released statements. "The arrest and detention of Aryan Khan for 26 days was unjustified," Maneshinde stated. Rohatgi said that "the dark chapter" was a "harrowing experience" for the Khan family.

97.title: Wore costumes weighing 4-6 kg in 'Samrat Prithviraj': Akshay Kumar
97.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar has revealed that the costumes he wore in 'Samrat Prithviraj' weighed around 4-6 kg. The actor added, "The actual warriors of our past, Samrat Prithviraj Chauhan, Shivaji Maharaj, would wear clothes that would weigh around 35-40 kilos." Earlier Manushi Chhillar said that it took "an army of people" to get her ready for the film's wedding sequence.

98.title: Hypersonic missile Zircon with 1,000 km range tested by Russia; pic released
98.article_body: Russia successfully test-fired a hypersonic Zircon cruise missile over a distance of about 1,000 km (625 miles), the Defence Ministry said on Saturday. The missile was fired from the Barents Sea and hit a target in the White Sea, it said. Images showed the missile being fired from a ship and blazing into the sky on a steep trajectory.

99.title: Denmark sends Harpoon missiles, US delivers howitzers to Ukraine
99.article_body: Ukraine's Defence Minister Oleksii Reznikov on Saturday announced that his country has started receiving Harpoon anti-ship missiles from Denmark and self-propelled howitzers from the US. "The coastal defence of our country will...be strengthened by Harpoon missiles," Reznikov said. Russia has imposed a naval blockade of Ukrainian ports, hampering the grain exports from the country.

100.title: Change in my mindset against spinners key to IPL 2022 success: GT's Miller
100.article_body: Ahead of GT-RR final, GT batter David Miller said a change in mindset against spinners has played a big part in his success in IPL 2022. "It has been something that I've worked hard on...I have changed one or two things," he added. Miller is currently the second highest run-scorer for GT with 449 runs from 15 matches.

101.title: Can't force female workers to work before 6 am & after 7 pm: UP govt
101.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government has ordered that no female worker shall be bound to work without her written consent before 6 am and after 7 pm in the state. The order also states that female employees should be provided free transportation, food and sufficient supervision, if working during the aforementioned hours. Employers have been told to ensure washrooms near workplace.

102.title: Man rapes 5-year-old girl, later throws her from rooftop in UP
102.article_body: A man has been arrested for allegedly raping a five-year-old girl and later throwing her from the rooftop of his house in Uttar Pradesh. Police said the suspect is also accused of killing the girl's father and had recently come out of jail on bail. The condition of the girl is said to be stable.

103.title: Woman branded as witch pardoned 300 yrs after wrongful conviction in US' Salem
103.article_body: A woman who was branded as a witch 329 years ago in Salem, Massachusetts has been officially pardoned by the state's lawmakers. Elizabeth Johnson Jr was convicted of witchcraft in 1693 and sentenced to death at the height of the infamous Salem witch trials. While all others wrongly accused of witchcraft were pardoned earlier, Elizabeth was never officially pardoned.

104.title: I've done nothing that'd make people hang their heads in shame: PM
104.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday said that he has spared no effort while serving the country in the last eight years. "I've neither allowed, nor personally...done any work that'll make...even a single person of India hang their head in shame," he said. "We've made an honest attempt to build the India of Mahatma Gandhi and Sardar Patel's dream," he added.

105.title: Hideously embarrassing: Saif on cross-dressing in 'Humshakals'
105.article_body: Actor Saif Ali Khan has reacted to his cross-dressed look in the 2014 film 'Humshakals', calling his imitation of a woman running "hideously embarrassing". The actor further said, "Oh my god. Oh my god, (director) Sajid (Khan), what did he do to us?" Saif had said in an earlier interview that he will never repeat the "mistake" that was 'Humshakals'.

106.title: Naxal carrying ₹1-lakh reward held, 2 others surrender in C'garh
106.article_body: Chhattisgarh Police have arrested Sodi Deva alias Prakash, a Naxal who was carrying a reward of ₹1 lakh on his head, an official said on Saturday. He was reportedly involved in the 2013 Naxal-police encounter, in which two jawans were martyred, the official said. In a separate incident, three lower-rung cadres surrendered before the police on Friday.

107.title: Fake ₹500 notes see over 100% jump in FY22, fake ₹2,000 notes rise 54%: RBI
107.article_body: Counterfeit notes detected in the denomination of ₹500 saw an increase of 101.9% during 2021-22 compared to the previous year, as per RBI's annual report. According to the data, ₹500 notes were worst hit, followed by ₹2,000 notes which saw a year-on-year increase of 54.16%. Counterfeit notes detected in denominations of ₹50 and ₹100 declined by 28.7% and 16.7%, respectively.

108.title: World isn't spending enough to prevent disasters: UN official
108.article_body: A UN official has highlighted that countries aren't spending enough to prevent disasters in the face of rising calamities. Of the $133 billion in available disaster-related financing from 2010 to 2019, only 4% went to reducing risks, the official said. "We're living in a multi-hazard world with compounding effects, and we need to invest more in prevention," the official added.

109.title: Jacqueline Fernandez gets court permission to travel to Abu Dhabi for IIFA awards
109.article_body: Actress Jacqueline Fernandez has received court permission to travel to Abu Dhabi to attend/ participate in IIFA awards 2022. She has received the permission to travel to Abu Dhabi between May 31 to June 6. The actress, who is being probed by ED, had moved an application in a Delhi court seeking permission to travel abroad for 15 days.

110.title: Any team can win Women's T20 Challenge title: Harmanpreet ahead of final
110.article_body: Ahead of Women's T20 Challenge final between Supernovas and Velocity, Supernovas' skipper Harmanpreet Kaur said any team can win the title. "The tournament is going great and every team is perfectly balanced...and is playing well," she added. "I am very happy that we are in the finals," she further said. The final will be played at MCA Stadium today.

111.title: 7 cases of Omicron subvariants BA.4 & BA.5 reported in Maharashtra
111.article_body: Maharashtra Health Department has confirmed the state's first few cases of the BA.4 and BA.5 subvariants of the Omicron COVID-19 variant. Four BA.4 cases and three BA.5 cases have been reported from Pune, the state Health Department said on Saturday. The first few cases of the subvariants were confirmed in India earlier this month.

112.title: BMC completes restoration of Mumbai's 16 heritage milestones
112.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has completed the restoration of the 16 heritage milestones in the city. The project to restore the milestones, which are about 200 years old, was launched in 2020 by the BMC. Under the project, the milestones were restored and plaques with QR codes to access the information about them were installed.

113.title: PM Modi inaugurates world's 1st nano urea liquid plant in Gujarat
113.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday inaugurated the world's first nano urea liquid plant by Indian Farmers Fertiliser Cooperative Limited (IFFCO) in Gujarat's Kalol. Developed with a ₹175-crore investment, the plant can produce 1.5 lakh 500 ml bottles of nano urea per day. The production unit aims to provide farmers the means to boost productivity and help increase their income.

114.title: India defeat Japan 2-1 in their first Super 4s match of men's Asia Cup 2022 hockey
114.article_body: India defeated Japan 2-1 in their first Super 4s match of men's Asia Cup 2022 hockey. With the win, India are currently placed on the top of the Super 4s points table. Manjeet Singh and Pawan Rajbhar scored for India in their match against Japan. India will next face Malaysia on Sunday. Malaysia are currently second on the points table.

115.title: Rainfall, thunderstorm predicted in several states/UTs; list released
115.article_body: Rainfall is likely over Northeast India and West Bengal and rainfall with thunderstorm over Bihar, Jharkhand and Odisha is likely over next 5 days. Rainfall is likely over Kerala, Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, Karnataka, Tamil Nadu and Puducherry. Other states/ UTs which may experience rainfall include Jammu & Kashmir, Uttarakhand, Punjab, Haryana, UP and Rajasthan.

116.title: Big B's granddaughter spreads menstrual awareness with street art
116.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan's granddaughter Navya Naveli Nanda on Saturday took to social media to share a picture of herself painting a mural on periods to celebrate World Menstrual Hygiene Day. She had earlier shared a video showing her team painting a wall in Mumbai's Ghatkopar East, writing, "This is our attempt to celebrate menstruation & make public places more period friendly."

117.title: 18-year-old Sriya Lenka becomes India's first K-pop star, joins Blackswan
117.article_body: An 18-year-old girl from Odisha has joined the K-pop girl group Blackswan, becoming India's first star in the Korean popular music genre, reports said. Sriya Lenka was among four people who underwent training after reportedly being chosen out of 4,000 people who had auditioned to join the group. Gabriela Strassburger Dalcin aka Gabi will also join Blackswan with Lenka.

118.title: Zilingo's PR Head resigns days after Bose fired as CEO, says 'I risk facing threats'
118.article_body: Singapore startup Zilingo's Head of PR and Communications, Naushaba Salahuddin, has resigned days after Ankiti Bose was fired as CEO for alleged financial irregularities. Salahuddin said individuals who now control Zilingo "have possibly made misleading and damaging statements" and due process has been violated. She added, "I possibly risk facing more threats and discredit for expressing dissent."

119.title: Kanye raps about custody battle with Kim in new song 'True Love'
119.article_body: Rapper Kanye West's new song 'True Love', which features late rapper XXXTentacion, is reportedly about his ongoing custody battle with ex-wife Kim Kardashian. The lyrics of the first verse are, "Wait, when you see the kids? I'll see y'all tomorrow. Wait, when the sunset? I see y'all tomorrow. Wait, when I pick 'em up? I feel like they borrowed."

120.title: Part of ceiling collapses at Pune Fire Brigade's control room
120.article_body: A part of the ceiling of the Pune Fire Brigade's control room collapsed on Friday evening. Telephone gadgets and equipment present in the room were reportedly damaged as the rubble fell on them. However, no casualties were reported in the incident. Chief Fire Officer Sunil Gilbile said that they have informed the Pune Municipal Corporation's ward office about the incident.

121.title: United Spirits to sell 32 brands, including Haywards, to Inbrew for ₹820 cr
121.article_body: United Spirits on Saturday announced that its board has approved the sale of 32 brands to Singapore-headquartered Inbrew Beverages for ₹820 crore. The transaction includes brands such as Haywards, Old Tavern, White-Mischief, Honey Bee, Green Label and Romanov. Further, United Spirits and Inbrew have entered into a five-year franchise arrangement for 11 other brands, including Bagpiper, it said.

122.title: G7 nations can lead the way on ending coal use: Germany
122.article_body: Germany has said that G7 countries can lead the way on ending the use of coal. Notably, Britain, France and Italy have set deadlines to end the use of coal in the next few years, while Germany and Canada are aiming to end its use by 2030. The US aims to end fossil fuel use for electricity generation by 2035.

123.title: Terrified to live alone after murder near my building: Devoleena
123.article_body: Television actress Devoleena Bhattacharjee has said that she is "terrified" to be living alone following a "horrific incident" near her building. The actress revealed that a man from a neighbouring building's housekeeping team killed a domestic worker and dumped the body on railway tracks. "Staying at home alone with my pet has suddenly become a bit scary," Devoleena added.

124.title: 'Boogie Woogie' was initially rejected, called downmarket: Jaaved
124.article_body: Jaaved Jaaferi has revealed that the 'Boogie Woogie' pilot was called "downmarket" and initially rejected by Sony TV executives. "Those new recruits in corporate companies, the young kids who hold significant positions [rejected it]," Jaaved added. He further said that then-head of Sony TV Sudesh Iyer bumped into Jaaved's co-judges Naved Jaaferi and Ravi Behl and told them it's "superhit".

125.title: Sameer Wankhede wanted to somehow implicate Aryan in drugs case: NCB inquiry
125.article_body: The Mumbai drugs-on-cruise case investigating officer Sameer Wankhede "was motivated to somehow implicate Aryan Khan", an SIT of the Narcotics Control Bureau has reportedly said. He "started looking at WhatsApp chats of Aryan without even formally seizing his mobile phone", the SIT said. NCB has dropped all charges against Aryan and five others in the case.

126.title: Haryana man barges into retired I-T Commissioner's home, stabs him
126.article_body: A 77-year-old retired Income Tax (I-T) Commissioner was stabbed thrice on his neck by an unidentified person, who had barged into the former's house in Haryana's Panchkula. The victim is now admitted to the ICU of a private hospital. The accused, who had covered his face with a handkerchief, was spotted on CCTV cameras installed in the locality.

127.title: They had a slightly better season: Manjrekar on RCB in IPL 2022
127.article_body: Reflecting on RCB's IPL 2022 campaign, commentator Sanjay Manjrekar said RCB had a slightly better season, adding some good things have happened for them. "But more is expected of them. Having come this far, they should have won," he added. RCB failed to qualify for the final after losing to RR in Qualifier 2 on Friday.

128.title: 3 sisters, their 2 kids found dead in Raj well; family alleges dowry death
128.article_body: Bodies of three sisters, two of whom were pregnant, and their two children were found inside a well in Rajasthan's Jaipur on Saturday. According to the deceased's family members, the three women were married to three brothers from one family. The women's father claimed they were murdered by their in-laws over dowry. Police have booked the women's husbands and in-laws.

129.title: Siraj didn't have best IPL but he will come back stronger: Hesson
129.article_body: Calling Mohammed Siraj a fine bowler, RCB Director of Cricket Operations Mike Hesson said the pacer didn't have his best IPL season but he'll come back stronger. "[Siraj] just didn't get us those new-ball wickets, didn't get the ball swinging and probably lost a bit of confidence," he added. Siraj ended IPL 2022 season with nine wickets from 15 matches.

130.title: Chris Lynn's six lands in garden of a house in UK, CCTV footage goes viral
130.article_body: Northamptonshire opener Chris Lynn smashed a six against Durham in T20 Blast 2022 which went on to land in the garden of a house in Northampton. A CCTV footage showing the ball in garden has gone viral. The 32-year-old batter scored 83 runs off 46 deliveries, including four fours and eight sixes, as Northamptonshire won the match by 31 runs.

131.title: Kartik Aaryan eats at roadside stall at 2 am amid Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2's success
131.article_body: Amid Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2's success, Kartik Aaryan was seen eating at a roadside joint on his way back from promoting the film. In a video, when asked about having a simple meal despite his film inching towards ₹100 crore, he said, "This is ₹100 crore happiness. Everyone eats the same thing." Kartik further revealed that the time was 2 am.

132.title: The great late Shane Warne is smiling on you: RCB as RR reach IPL 2022 final
132.article_body: After RR defeated RCB in the Qualifier 2 to reach the final of IPL 2022, RCB tweeted, "The great late Shane Warne is smiling on you." RCB added, "Well played...and good luck for the final." Warne had led RR to victory in the inaugural season of IPL in 2008. RR will face GT in final of IPL 2022.

133.title: Actors should do homework, not just say lines with dialect: Sonu
133.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood has stated that it is important for actors to do their homework when portraying historical characters. "[They can't] just come on sets, wear the costumes and say the lines with the dialect," the actor added. Sonu will be seen portraying the role of Chand Bardai in upcoming film 'Samrat Prithviraj' which stars Akshay Kumar and Manushi Chhillar.

134.title: My market as child star ended when I lost my first two teeth: Kamal Haasan
134.article_body: Kamal Haasan while recalling his childhood acting days, said he was "like a trained parrot" who didn't know what he was doing. "It was only when I lost my first two teeth that my market as...child star ended," he added. The actor said he feels lucky to have had worked with MGR and Shivaji (Ganesan) as a child actor.

135.title: Ship to take metal from Mariupol to Russia; Ukraine calls it 'looting'
135.article_body: A ship has entered Ukraine's Mariupol for the first time since Russia completed its capture of the port city to load metal and ship it east to Russia, Russian state-owned news agency TASS reported. The ship is set to transport some 2,700 tonnes of metal, it added. This is "looting" by Russia, Ukraine's Human Rights Ombudsman Lyudmyla Denisova said.

136.title: Youth Cong leader tries to remarry at MP mass wedding for scheme benefits, held
136.article_body: National Students' Union of India (NSUI) coordinator Netik Choudhary was arrested for trying to remarry his wife at a mass wedding event in Madhya Pradesh's Sagar to avail Mukhyamantri Kanyadan Yojana's benefits. The Youth Congress leader had reportedly married his wife 15 days ago. Choudhary was waiting at the venue when he was noticed by the organisers, who informed police.

137.title: Minister Anurag Thakur runs on treadmill at college event in Pune
137.article_body: Union Youth Affairs and Sports Minister Anurag Thakur on Saturday visited Pune-based Savitribai Phule Pune University for a ceremony to name a sports complex after Indian athlete and wrestler KD Jadhav. During the visit, Thakur took part in several sports activities there. In a video, Thakur was also seen running on a treadmill for about a minute at the university.

138.title: Centre to develop framework for checking fake reviews on e-comm platforms
138.article_body: The Department of Consumer Affairs (DoCA) will develop a framework aimed at curbing fake reviews posted on e-commerce websites, the Centre announced. DoCA will develop these frameworks after studying best practices available globally, the Centre said. "E-comm players must disclose as to how they choose the most relevant reviews for display in a fair and transparent manner," DoCA Secretary said.

139.title: Shah Rukh has an 'eye for interiors', helped design production office: Gauri
139.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan's wife Gauri Khan said the actor has a 'keen eye for interiors' and was an important part of designing the office of their production house, Red Chillies Entertainment. "He had...huge say in design and inputs about colours and possible uses of...ceiling," Gauri added. Further, she called their Mumbai residence 'Mannat' her most memorable interior design project.

140.title: Shane Warne is looking down on us with a lot of pride: RR's Jos Buttler
140.article_body: Reacting to RR reaching an IPL final after 14 years, RR's Jos Buttler said, "Shane Warne is such an influential figure for...RR and having led the team to success in the first season, we'll miss him dearly." "We know he is looking down on us with a lot of pride today," added Buttler. Warne played 55 matches for RR.

141.title: PM Modi & his drones are both blind to people's sufferings: Cong
141.article_body: Reacting to PM Narendra Modi's remark that he conducts surprise inspections of government work with the help of drones, Congress said, "PM Modi and his drones are alike." "Both [PM and drones] are blind to...people's sufferings," it added. Congress spokesperson Sunil Ahire tweeted, "PM Modi's drones only see what suits BJP's agenda. Chinese intrusion is a matter deliberately left unseen."

142.title: Govt hospital doctor held for sexually harassing nurse in UP's Bareilly
142.article_body: A doctor of a primary health centre in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly was arrested for allegedly sexually harassing and assaulting a staff nurse. The case against the doctor, identified as Ram Krishna Verma, was lodged at the Bahedi Police station on the complaint of the staff nurse, police said. Notably, the accused allegedly hit the victim when she objected to harassment.

143.title: I'm a majnu, didn't take a thing from govt in 12 yrs: Pak PM amid ₹621cr fraud trial
143.article_body: Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif on Saturday appeared in court in connection with the PKR 16 billion (around ₹621.22 crore) money laundering case lodged against him and his sons. "I have not taken anything from the government in 12.5 years...God made me the PM...I'm a 'majnu' (insane) and I did not take my legal right, my salary and benefits," said Sharif.

144.title: I'm divorced, wasn't sure if I'd be accepted by Gautam's family: Kanika
144.article_body: Singer Kanika Kapoor, who recently tied the knot with businessman Gautam Hathiramani, has said she was surprised when Gautam proposed to her. "I wasn't sure whether we would ever get married," she said, adding, "The fact that I'm divorced with three children, I wasn't sure whether I would be accepted by him and his family. But I was wrong."

145.title: I'd be lying if I said my kids didn't feel anxious before my wedding: Kanika
145.article_body: Kanika Kapoor, speaking about how her children reacted to her decision to marry Gautam Hathiramani, said, "I'd be lying if I said...they didn't feel anxious." "A few days before...wedding, my youngest daughter...said, 'Now we're going to give you away.' I was surprised...and told her...not just me, we all are marrying him," she added. Kanika was earlier married to Raj Chandok.

146.title: Everyone in GT have stuck to their roles, played them perfectly: Parthiv
146.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Parthiv Patel has said IPL debutants GT have reached the final in this season because every team member has stuck to their roles and played them perfectly. GT had won 10 out of 14 matches in the league stage and topped the points table. GT will face RR in the final at Narendra Modi Stadium on Sunday.

147.title: Man kills wife, 2 kids with woodcutter then dies by suicide in TN
147.article_body: A 41-year-old man allegedly died by suicide after murdering his wife and two children, aged nine and 13, using an electric woodcutter at his house in Tamil Nadu's Chennai, police said on Saturday. The man had apparently done so due to financial distress, a police official said. The incident came to light after neighbours checked the house due to suspicion.

148.title: Mohammed Siraj abused on social media after RCB fail to reach IPL 2022 final
148.article_body: RCB pacer Mohammed Siraj was abused on social media after RCB failed to reach IPL 2022 final. Siraj, who conceded 31 runs in 2 overs against RR in Qualifier 2, was targeted, with some trolls giving death threats to his family. "If you want to criticise, criticise constructively," a fan wrote. "Siraj doesn't deserve this type of hate," another wrote.

149.title: Bihar government allows exploration of India's 'largest' gold reserve
149.article_body: Bihar government has decided to allow exploration of India's "largest" gold reserve in Jamui, Additional Chief Secretary-cum-Mines Commissioner Harjot Kaur Bamhrah said. Bihar is likely to sign an MoU with a central agency or agencies for preliminary stage exploration, Bamhrah added. Around 222.88 million tonnes of gold reserve is present in Jamui, as per a Geological Survey of India survey.

150.title: I try to hold one end up, let other bowlers pick wickets: Rashid Khan
150.article_body: Gujarat Titans spinner Rashid Khan has spoken on his role in the franchise ahead of the IPL final against the Rajasthan Royals in Ahmedabad on Sunday. "Teams are playing it safe against me. So, I am trying to keep it tight and that increases the chance of picking up wickets by the bowler at the other end," Khan said.

151.title: Delhi govt did nothing: Union Min on IAS couple's transfer over Delhi stadium row
151.article_body: Speaking on the Delhi stadium row in which an IAS couple was accused of using Delhi government-run Thyagraj Stadium for walking their dog, Union Minister Anurag Thakur said, "Delhi government did nothing. Centre intervened and transferred them to distant places." "It's these athletes who win medals for our country. No one should interfere with it," he added.

152.title: Bengaluru metro services on Purple Line to be affected tonight
152.article_body: Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Limited has said the metro services on the Purple Line will be affected from Saturday night to Sunday morning amid maintenance works. The metro services will be halted between Baiyappanahalli and MG Road stations from Saturday 9.30pm till Sunday 7am. During this period, trains on the Purple Line will only run between the MG Road-Kengeri stations.

153.title: Russian billionaire named wife as owner of his firms day before EU sanctions: Report
153.article_body: Russian billionaire businessman Andrey Melnichenko ceded ownership of two of the world's largest coal and fertilisers companies to his wife the day before he was sanctioned by the European Union, as per a report. Notably, the sanctions which included freezing his assets and banning his entry into the EU, didn’t apply to his wife or the couple's children.

154.title: Won't criticise Samson for not scoring big runs in IPL 2022: Deep Dasgupta
154.article_body: Ex-India wicketkeeper-batter Deep Dasgupta said he won't criticise RR captain Sanju Samson for not scoring big runs in IPL 2022, as he has made sure that opener Jos Buttler is not under pressure. "If Buttler is playing the way he [is], someone has to take the responsibility and Samson has done well in that regard this season," added Dasgupta.

155.title: 35-yr-old Dalit man chained, starved, assaulted for over a day in Rajasthan
155.article_body: A 35-year-old Dalit man was allegedly starved and kept chained in a cattle shed in Rajasthan's Bundi district for over 31 hours. The victim was assaulted for dishonouring a pledge to work as an unskilled labourer for the main accused, identified as Paramjit Singh. A case has been registered against six men including Paramjit's brother, police said.

156.title: Jodie Foster to play lead role in 'True Detective' season 4
156.article_body: Jodie Foster is set to star in the fourth season of HBO's 'True Detective' series. The actress will play the lead role of Detective Liz Danvers. According to Deadline, Foster will also executive produce the show along with Barry Jenkins and Alan Page Arriaga. Directed by Issa Lopez, the show will mark Foster's first major TV role as an adult.

157.title: Shraddha Arya gets apology from designer who stole her fittings
157.article_body: Television actress Shraddha Arya, who was robbed by her interior designer earlier this week, has received an apology note from him along with the fittings and fixtures which were stolen from her new house in Mumbai's Andheri. The actress shared a note on social media thanking her fans and journalists. She wrote, "Lesson learnt: Never leave your work site unattended."

158.title: Prasidh troubles Kohli a lot, he has trapped him many times: Kaif
158.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli's dismissal in IPL 2022's Eliminator by RR's Prasidh Krishna, Mohammad Kaif said, "Kohli...played a nothing shot...The ball was going out after pitching and he flirted with it." "He was forced to do that because the ball went in front of his eyes and [Prasidh] troubles him a lot. He has trapped him many times," added Kaif.

159.title: Mumbai Traffic Police to conduct two-hour no honking drive today
159.article_body: Mumbai Traffic Police will conduct a no honking drive on prominent roads in the city from 5 pm to 7 pm on Saturday. The initiative is a part of an awareness programme for motorists to curb noise pollution, an official said. The traffic police will take action against drivers or vehicle owners in case of violations, the official added.

160.title: Kiara took care of me and prayed for me when I got COVID: Varun
160.article_body: Varun Dhawan, who'll be seen alongside Kiara Advani in the film 'Jugjugg Jeeyo', revealed that the actress took care of him when he tested positive for COVID-19. "She prayed for me which was very touching. Just genuine love and care and...I think we really became close friends," he added. Varun contracted COVID-19 during the filming of 'Jugjugg Jeeyo' in 2020.

161.title: RCB's total of 157 in Eliminator vs RR wasn't good at all: Sachin
161.article_body: Sachin Tendulkar said RCB's total of 157 in IPL 2022's Eliminator against RR wasn't a good total "at all". "Along with Prasidh Krishna, Obed McCoy was the key bowler. Both kept Bangalore under pressure," added Sachin. Discussing RCB batter Virat Kohli's dismissal by Prasidh, Tendulkar stated, "Kohli was beaten by the bounce...That was a fantastic delivery."

162.title: Test match is for 5 days, it's only day 3: Karti on CBI questioning
162.article_body: Congress MP Karti Chidambaram on Saturday arrived at CBI Headquarters in Delhi for the third consecutive day and said, "A test match is for five days, this is just day three." Karti is being questioned in the bribe-for-visa case. A day earlier, Karti had written to the Lok Sabha Speaker over the alleged breach of his parliamentary privilege by CBI.

163.title: Founder of Japanese terror group 'Red Army' freed after 20 years
163.article_body: The co-founder of the Japanese Red Army terrorist group has been freed from prison after serving 20 years for masterminding the 1974 siege of the French Embassy in The Hague. Fusako Shigenobu, who was arrested in 2000, was among the world's most notorious women in the 1970s and 1980s. The Japanese Red Army had carried out several attacks worldwide.

164.title: 875 kg tomatoes, 500 kg lemons, 300 kg capsicum stolen from Gurugram market
164.article_body: Over 875 kg tomatoes, 500 kg lemons and 15 packets containing over 300 kg capsicum were allegedly stolen from a shop in Gurugram's Khandsa vegetable market, the police said. "This is the first time a theft has taken place since I have been working here. We have suffered a loss of over ₹50,000-₹55,000," a worker at the shop said.

165.title: 2 killed, child injured as speeding truck rams into parked bus in UP
165.article_body: At least two people were killed and a child was injured after a speeding truck rammed into a parked bus on the Agra-Etawah highway in Uttar Pradesh, police said. The driver of the bus had parked it after it developed a technical snag. The driver was under the bus to fix it when the truck rammed into it, police added.

166.title: Hold no grudges, want to play in Australia again: Djokovic
166.article_body: Twenty-time Grand Slam champion Novak Djokovic has said that he wants to play in Australia again despite not being allowed earlier this year due to not having a COVID-19 vaccination. "I don't know anything about...whether I'm going to be allowed to come back to Australia...I would like to go there...I don't hold any grudges," the 35-year-old Serbian tennis player said.

167.title: Police arrest 3 men after 3-yr-old girl crushed to death in B'luru
167.article_body: After a three-year-old girl was crushed to death by a water tanker in Bengaluru, police have arrested three men, including the tanker's owner. The deceased girl, Pratiksha Bhat, was playing outside her house when the tanker's driver, who was trying to reverse the vehicle, didn't notice her and knocked her down. She came under the vehicle's rear wheel and died.

168.title: Everyone wanted to give clothes to Deepika, sourcing clothes for Cannes was tough: Meera
168.article_body: Meera Chopra, speaking about her experience at Cannes Film Festival, said, "Going to the festival was actually an overwhelming feeling...I went there to promote my film 'Safed'." However, she revealed that sourcing clothes for red carpet appearances was tough. "Most of the Indian designers wanted to give clothes to Deepika Padukone, or wanted to [dress] a bigger celebrity," Meera added.

169.title: Samson has been exceptional as batter, wicketkeeper, skipper: Sangakkara
169.article_body: After RR reached IPL 2022 final with a seven-wicket win over RCB, RR Director of Cricket Operations Kumar Sangakkara said skipper Sanju Samson has been exceptional. He added that Samson has done a good job in wicket-keeping, batting and leading the side in the tournament this season. The 2008 champions RR will face debutants GT in the final on Sunday.

170.title: Twitter rejects Musk-backer Durban's resignation from board
170.article_body: Twitter will not accept Tesla CEO Elon Musk-backer Egon Durban's resignation from the board. This comes days after the platform's shareholders blocked Durban's re-election at an annual meeting. Durban failed to receive the majority votes in the re-election held earlier this week due to "voting policies of certain institutional investors regarding board service limitations", Twitter said.

171.title: China, Russia block UN statement on Myanmar crisis: Reports
171.article_body: China and Russia have blocked a UN Security Council statement expressing concern about the violence and serious humanitarian situation in Myanmar, reports said. The statement was reportedly aimed at pushing Myanmar's military leaders to take steps to resolve the crisis. On Thursday, China and Russia vetoed a US-sponsored UN resolution to impose more sanctions on North Korea over missile tests.

172.title: Policeman suspended over deaths of woman, 2 daughters in UP's Baghpat
172.article_body: A sub-inspector was suspended over the deaths of a 45-year-old woman and her two daughters who allegedly consumed poison in his presence in UP's Baghpat, police said. The woman and her daughters, aged 19 and 17, consumed poison fearing arrest. Police raided their house looking for the woman's son who had allegedly kidnapped a Dalit woman and eloped with her.

173.title: 25 passengers injured as bus overturns in Jammu and Kashmir
173.article_body: At least 25 passengers were injured after the bus they were travelling in overturned in the Battal Ballian area along the highway in Jammu and Kashmir's Udhampur. The injured persons were shifted to the district hospital for treatment, following which six of them were further referred to a government hospital in Jammu. The bus was on its way to Doda.

174.title: Imran Khan to make comeback, will direct a film: Reports
174.article_body: Imran Khan is all set to return to the film industry as a director, as per reports. "Direction was what Imran wanted to do. He never wanted to be an actor. He is now working on the script of his first directorial," reports quoted a source as saying. According to reports, the film will go on the floors in 2023.

175.title: Any deal with Russia isn't worth a broken penny: Ukrainian negotiator
175.article_body: Ukrainian presidential advisor and peace talks negotiator Mykhailo Podolyak on Saturday said that it is impossible to negotiate with Russia that "lies cynically and propagandistically". "Any agreement with Russia isn't worth a broken penny," Podolyak added.
