"Russia has proved that it is a barbarian country that threatens world security...A barbarian can only be stopped by force," he further said.

176.title: 90 fall sick in Gurugram society; water contamination suspected
176.article_body: Over 90 residents of Westend Heights in DLF Phase 5 fell sick allegedly after consuming drinking water supplied by the Gurugram Metropolitan Development Authority. Moreover, a two-year-old child from the society has been hospitalised due to the suspected water contamination. Gurugram's Chief Medical Officer, Dr Virender Yadav, said, "Most of the residents are suffering from nausea and vomiting."

177.title: It breaks my heart to see Boris Becker in prison: Novak Djokovic
177.article_body: Novak Djokovic said it breaks his heart to see six-time singles' Grand Slam champion and his former coach Boris Becker in prison. He added, "Boris was always so nice to me and my family...and we had a great relationship throughout the years...and achieved great things." Becker was jailed for 2.5 years for hiding assets after bankruptcy in UK.

178.title: An army of people worked on bridal look, took a long time: Manushi on Prithviraj
178.article_body: Manushi Chhillar, while recalling the wedding sequence in her upcoming movie 'Samrat Prithviraj', said, "Though it's a short one, it took a...long time for me to get ready." "There was an army of people working on me to get me ready," Manushi said, adding, "There were countless people trying to put layers and layers of clothes and jewellery on me."

179.title: Depp is a monster: Heard's lawyer in Depp-Heard closing statement
179.article_body: Amber Heard's lawyer Ben Rottenborn called Johnny Depp a monster in his closing statement in the Depp-Heard defamation trial. He said, "Let's see the monster," before playing a video of Depp slamming cabinets in the former couple's kitchen. Depp's lawyer Camille Vasquez said, "Either [Heard is] a victim of truly horrific abuse or she's a woman...willing to say absolutely anything."

180.title: People think I am Jos Buttler's wife: RR batter Rassie van der Dussen's wife Lara
180.article_body: RR batter Rassie van der Dussen's wife Lara has said that people think she is Jos Buttler's wife. "I...think it's because I've been on camera...a few times. Dhanashree and I cannot control ourselves next to the field...Jos has been getting hundreds...and maybe the excitement has got people thinking probably I'm part of him, so it's quite interesting," she added.

181.title: Getting rape, death threats: BJP spokesperson after appearing on debate on Gyanvapi
181.article_body: BJP National Spokesperson Nupur Sharma has alleged that she is being "bombarded with rape, death and beheading threats" against herself and her family after her appearance on a TV debate on the Gyanvapi issue. "I've communicated the same to Delhi Police," she said. She blamed fact-checker Mohammed Zubair for the alleged threats after he tweeted a video of the debate.

182.title: Startup Co-founder makes it to 'Forbes 30 Under 30', chat with his father goes viral
182.article_body: Harish Uthayakumar, Co-founder of an edtech startup BlueLearn, shared a WhatsApp chat screenshot on Twitter when he told his father that he had made it to the 'Forbes 30 under 30' list. While his father replied with two thumbs up emojis, his chat became widely circulated online. Yuvaa CEO commented, "Peak dad behaviour," while another person wrote, "Indian dad supremacy".

183.title: 15-yr-old inspired by KGF smokes full pack of cigarettes, falls severely ill in Hyd
183.article_body: A 15-year-old boy, who was inspired by the movie KGF: Chapter 2, smoked a full pack of cigarettes and fell severely ill in Hyderabad. The boy who watched the movie thrice in two days developed a severe throat ache and cough and was rushed to the hospital for treatment. Doctors said they successfully treated the teenager, apart from counselling him.

184.title: 3 inspired by 'Fast & Furious' steal 40 luxury cars in Delhi, held
184.article_body: Three men, inspired by Hollywood series 'Fast & Furious', were arrested for stealing over 40 luxury cars from across Delhi-NCR over the past one month using high-tech gadgets, including scanners and GPS jammers. The stolen cars were then sold via expensive deals in Rajasthan and Uttar Pradesh's Meerut. The accused unlocked cars by using a software-based hacking device, police said.

185.title: Have seen both highs and lows, prepared for everything now: Fatima
185.article_body: Actress Fatima Sana Shaikh, in an interview, opened up about facing failures in her career. "Thugs of Hindostan is a proper example. When the film tanked, it had hit me," Fatima said. The actress added that she has seen both the highs and lows of her career and is thus prepared for everything now. "I have become calmer," Fatima added.

186.title: Troops may withdraw from eastern region amid Russian advance: Ukraine
186.article_body: Ukraine has said that its troops could withdraw from their last pocket of resistance in Luhansk to avoid being captured by Russian forces pressing an advance in the east. There are some 10,000 Russian troops in the eastern region, the Governor of Ukraine's Luhansk region, Serhiy Gaidai, said. Ukraine has asked the West for long-range weaponry to resist Russian advance.

187.title: Rare sight: Kejriwal as Delhi Transport Commissioner travels by bus
187.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Saturday lauded Delhi Transport Commissioner Ashish Kundra as he travelled by bus. "A rare sight to see transport commissioner...travelling by...bus to take a first-hand view from travellers on the problems being faced by them," Kejriwal said. IAS officer Kundra on Saturday posted some pictures of him travelling on a bus. "Bus journey...Saturday feel," Kundra tweeted.

188.title: I'd love to see Sehwag, Kohli or Ashwin take up umpiring: Simon Taufel
188.article_body: Ex-umpire Simon Taufel has said that he would love to see Virender Sehwag, Virat Kohli or Ravichandran Ashwin take up umpiring. "They seem to be very well on top of the laws and playing conditions of the game at the moment," he added. "You have really got to have a personality and desire to want to do it," he stated.

189.title: Russia successfully tests hypersonic missile amid war in Ukraine
189.article_body: Russia has said that it has successfully test-fired a hypersonic missile over a distance of about 1,000 kilometres. The Zircon cruise missile was fired from Barents Sea and hit a target in White Sea. Despite the war in Ukraine, Russia has continued to stage high-profile weapons tests to remind the world of its prowess in missile technology, according to Reuters.

190.title: IndiGo fined ₹5 lakh for denying boarding to specially-abled child in Ranchi
190.article_body: The Directorate General of Civil Aviation has fined IndiGo ₹5 lakh for denying boarding to a specially-abled boy at the Ranchi airport earlier this month. The DGCA said that the "deficient handling" by the airline staff ended up exacerbating the situation. "A more compassionate handling would have smoothened the nerves and calmed the child," DGCA stated.

191.title: Pune ZP launches citizen feedback portal 'Majhi ZP, Majha Aadhikar'
191.article_body: Pune Zilla Parishad (ZP) has launched a social audit and feedback portal called 'Majhi ZP, Majha Aadhikar'. "Through this programme, we are seeking both appreciation and complaints of...works done through public money," the body's CEO Ayush Prasad said. He added that through the portal, which will be available on Pune ZP's website, citizens can submit feedback with comments and photos.

192.title: 2 women hide 161 cocaine capsules in stomach, held at Delhi Airport
192.article_body: In separate incidents, two women from Uganda were arrested at Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport after nearly two kilograms of cocaine worth ₹28 crore was found hidden in their stomachs, customs officials said. The women had concealed the cocaine in a total of 161 capsules and swallowed them. They were taken to RML Hospital for removal of capsules.

193.title: Over 1 lakh commuters hop on Delhi's new electric buses in first 3 days
193.article_body: Around one lakh commuters travelled on Delhi's new AC electric buses in first three days after being flagged off by Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on May 24. Taking to Twitter, AAP wrote, "Arvind Kejriwal government's e-buses get bumper response from Delhiites." The Delhi government had made travel free of cost for the first three days in the new buses.

194.title: Earlier our best was coming 4th in Olympics but Neeraj changed it all: PT Usha
194.article_body: Former Indian track and field athlete PT Usha has said that Neeraj Chopra winning an Olympic gold medal in javelin throw has "changed" everything for Indian athletics. "Earlier, the best we could do was reach fourth place in the Olympics but Neeraj's feat has changed all," Usha said. She also added that she started following javelin events because of Chopra.

195.title: Trent Boult gives his RR jersey to young fan after Qualifier 2 win, RR share video
195.article_body: RR have shared a video showing Trent Boult giving his RR jersey to a young fan after their victory against RCB in the Qualifier 2 of IPL 2022 on Friday. "How can you not love Trent Boult?" RR wrote alongside the video. Boult registered figures of 4-0-28-1 against RCB. RR will face GT in IPL 2022 final on Sunday.

196.title: Attending film festival like Cannes makes one feel fortunate: Richa Chadha
196.article_body: Actress Richa Chadha, while remembering her Cannes debut, said attending a "prestigious" film festival like Cannes makes one feel fortunate. "It's a matter of pride for the entire team if their film is being shown at the...festival," Richa stated. The actress had earlier shared pictures from her visit to the film festival for her films 'Gangs of Wasseypur' and 'Masaan'.

197.title: England can save Test cricket from current downward trend: McCullum
197.article_body: England's newly-appointed red-ball coach Brendon McCullum has said that England is a nation which can save Test cricket from the ongoing "downward trend". "If you look where (Test cricket) sits, it's probably on a slightly downward trend. One nation that can really change things is England, with the tradition and the fan following (of Test cricket)," McCullum said.

198.title: Anil Agarwal meets Bill Gates, says 'his knowledge about India surprises me'
198.article_body: Vedanta Resources' billionaire Chairman Anil Agarwal met the world's fourth-richest person Bill Gates during World Economic Forum 2022 in Davos. Sharing a picture with the Microsoft Co-founder, Agarwal wrote on LinkedIn, "He always surprises me with how much he knows about India and his love for Indian food!" He said the two bonded over their initial struggles as first-generation entrepreneurs.

199.title: Which 10 countries topped latest Travel & Tourism Development rankings by WEF?
199.article_body: The World Economic Forum (WEF) recently released its latest Travel and Tourism Development Index, which ranked Japan at the top. The US, Spain, France, Germany, Switzerland, Australia, the UK, Singapore and Italy were also among the top 10 countries on the index. India ranked 54th on the global index but topped the South Asia region rankings.

200.title: Viral Bihar girl who hopped to school gets artificial limb, IAS officer shares pic
200.article_body: A 10-year-old girl from Bihar, who was seen hopping to school on one leg in a viral video, got an artificial limb. An image of the girl, named Seema, from Jamui district, has been shared by IAS officer Awanish Sharan. It shows her wearing a prosthetic leg. "Power of social media," Awanish wrote in the caption.

201.title: I draw a line at rape threats: Ex-Zilingo CEO on seeking legal protection in S'pore
201.article_body: Zilingo's former CEO Ankiti Bose has obtained an Expedited Protection Order from Singapore Courts against a Twitter user after being fired from the e-commerce startup. "I fear...there are elements out there that might benefit from intimidating me...by weaponising the media and social media," Bose said. "I've tried to let it go...but I draw the line at rape threats," she added.

202.title: 2 wanted criminals shot dead in Ghaziabad in 2 separate encounters
202.article_body: Ghaziabad Police shot dead two wanted criminals in two separate encounters on Friday. The criminals, identified as Billu and Rakesh, carried a bounty of ₹1 lakh and ₹50,000 on their heads respectively, police said. The first incident took place in Indirapuram and the second in Madhuban Bapudham. Billu was wanted in a double murder case last month.

203.title: RTO to not issue new auto permits in Pune division: Report
203.article_body: Pune Regional Transport Office has reportedly decided not to issue new auto-rickshaw permits in the Pune division. Pune Regional Transport Officer Ajit Shinde said that there are a large number of autos in the division and to stop this increasing number of autos this decision has been taken. There are reportedly over 82,000 auto-rickshaw permits in the Pune division currently.

204.title: Govt to develop framework to check fake reviews on online shopping websites
204.article_body: The central government on Saturday said that in order to protect consumer interest, it will develop a framework to keep a check on fake reviews posted on e-commerce websites. As per an official statement, the framework will be developed after studying the present mechanism being followed by the e-commerce websites and the best practices available globally.

205.title: 'Mr. India' an iconic film, shouldn't be remade: Satish Kaushik
205.article_body: Actor-filmmaker Satish Kaushik has said that his 1987 film 'Mr. India', which also starred Anil Kapoor, Amrish Puri and Sridevi, shouldn't be remade or given a sequel today. He added that it's "such an iconic film with such great legacy that if it ever comes out then it can only be pulled off by Anil Kapoor and no other actor".

206.title: Bengaluru police provide green corridor for liver transportation
206.article_body: Bengaluru Traffic Police on Friday provided a green corridor for liver transportation between 12.30 pm and 12.40 pm from St John's Medical College Hospital to Apollo Hospital, BG Road. The traffic police also shared a video of the same. Earlier, the traffic police also provided a green corridor for transporting a live heart and a liver separately on May 4.

207.title: Randeep shares his first look as Veer Savarkar from latter's biopic
207.article_body: Randeep Hooda on Saturday unveiled his first look as Vinayak Damodar Savarkar from an upcoming film based on the latter's life. He shared his look on the occasion of Savarkar's 139th birth anniversary. "This is a salute to...one of the tallest unsung heroes of India's struggle for freedom," Randeep wrote. Titled 'Swatantra Veer Savarkar', it'll be directed by Mahesh Manjrekar.

208.title: Pune woman trying to buy two-wheeler on OLX cheated of ₹71,060
208.article_body: A woman from Pune was cheated of ₹71,060 by a cyber fraudster who posted an advertisement to sell a two-wheeler on OLX, police said. "The fraudster lured the complainant with an offer to sell the two-wheeler at a low price...But the woman never got the vehicle," an officer said. The victim had contacted the phone number mentioned in the advertisement.

209.title: Tried to built India Bapu, Sardar Patel dreamt of: PM on 8 yrs of NDA govt
209.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday said, in past eight years, the government made honest efforts to build India as dreamt by Mahatma Gandhi and Sardar Patel. "Bapu wanted an India that would empower the poor, Dalit, victim, tribals, women," he stated. Over the years, government gave top priority to the service and welfare of poor, PM Modi added.

210.title: BMC starts construction of underpasses for animals in Aarey Colony
210.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation has started building animal underpasses at Mumbai's Aarey Colony in order to avoid animal-human conflict. Currently, three underpasses are being built and 15 more will be built once the monsoon season ends, a BMC official said. Notably, the locations for the underpasses are selected based on the data collected with the help of camera traps.

211.title: Depressed over mother's death, B'luru man dumps ₹1.3 cr BMW car in river
211.article_body: A Bengaluru man, depressed over his mother's death, drove his BMW car worth ₹1.3 crore into Cauvery river. Seeing the car drowning in the river, the localities suspected it to be an accident and informed the police about it. During investigation, the man's family told police that he was depressed and drove his car into the river out of dejection.

212.title: Iran seizes 2 Greek tankers in Persian Gulf amid row over US oil grab
212.article_body: Iranian forces seized two Greek tankers on Friday in helicopter-launched raids in the Persian Gulf, officials said. This comes after Iran warned it would take "punitive action" against Athens over the confiscation of Iranian oil by the US from a tanker held off the Greek coast. Iran's Revolutionary Guards said the tankers were seized due to unspecified violations.

213.title: R Praggnanandhaa writes exam hours after finishing runner-up in chess tournament at 2 am
213.article_body: India's 16-year-old Grandmaster R Praggnanandhaa appeared for his Class 11 exam at 8.45 am on Friday, hours after finishing runner-up in Chessable Masters tournament. Praggnanandhaa's final match against world number two Ding Liren ended at 2.20 am. "Last few days have been incredibly tiring...it's a first for me, writing exams and playing a tournament simultaneously," he said.

214.title: Starlink has been approved in Nigeria & Mozambique: Elon Musk
214.article_body: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk took to Twitter to announce that Starlink has been permitted to provide its service in Nigeria and Mozambique. This comes days after Musk answered a tweet about the service launch in Africa, saying, "Yes, first countries in Africa to be announced coming soon." Starlink is currently available in over 30 countries.

215.title: Thanks but no thanks: Ola CEO on Musk's tweet about Tesla manufacturing in India
215.article_body: Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal responded to Tesla CEO Elon Musk's tweet regarding the manufacture of Tesla in India and wrote, "Thanks but no thanks". Earlier, a Twitter user asked Musk if Tesla would be manufactured in India, to which he replied, "Tesla won't put a manufacturing plant in any location where we aren't allowed first to sell & service cars."

216.title: Kohli always wants to be on the front foot no matter what: Manjrekar
216.article_body: Discussing Virat Kohli's dismissal in IPL 2022's Eliminator, ex-India batter Sanjay Manjrekar tweeted, "Front foot to a short of length bouncing ball cost him his wicket again." "Kohli wanting to be on the front foot no matter what is not helping his cause," added Manjrekar in his tweet. "Mental toughness takes you far...but technical issues cannot be ignored," stated Manjrekar.

217.title: Shouldn't be taken seriously: Gehlot on Chandna's 'free me from post' tweet
217.article_body: After Rajasthan Sports Minister Ashok Chandna requested state CM Ashok Gehlot to free him from his "dishonourable" post, the CM said, "[Chandna] might've come under some stress and commented. It should not be taken seriously." Furthermore, Chandna tweeted a day later that he and Gehlot held a "meaningful" discussion and added that the Congress family is "united" for 2023 polls.

218.title: Virat Kohli made more mistakes in IPL 2022 than in his entire career: Sehwag
218.article_body: Former India opener Virender Sehwag has said that Virat Kohli made more mistakes in IPL 2022 than in his entire career. "This is not the Virat Kohli we know. This is someone else," he added. Kohli scored 341 runs in IPL 2022 at an average of 22.73. He got out for three golden ducks in the tournament.

219.title: 'The Conjuring' house sells for over ₹11 crore in US; pics surface
219.article_body: A US home, which apparently witnessed paranormal activities chronicled in the 2013 horror film The Conjuring, is being sold for $1.525 million (over ₹11 crore). The sellers, paranormal investigators Jenn and Cory Heinzen, had bought the home in 2019 for $439,000 and had set $1.2 million as the asking price. The buyer of the house is a 58-year-old real-estate developer.

220.title: Musk shares cartoon on freeing Twitter's blue bird from a cage, Twitter users react
220.article_body: Amid the Twitter acquisition deal being put on hold, Tesla CEO Elon Musk shared a cartoon featuring a caricature resembling him freeing Twitter's iconic blue bird from a cage. Meanwhile, Dogecoin Co-creator Billy Markus commented, "Despite all my rage, I am still just a bird in a cage." Another Twitter user wrote, "Twitter is about to get more interesting."

221.title: 19-yr-old boy shot dead in Delhi, found lying in pool of blood: Police
221.article_body: A 19-year-old boy was shot dead in Delhi's Khajuri Khas area on Friday and was found lying in a pool of blood, police said. "On physical inspection, a bullet injury mark was found on his chest," DCP (Northeast Delhi) Sanjay Kumar Sain said. "A suspect has been zeroed in and he is being tracked...will be interrogated accordingly," he added.

222.title: Life goes on even when you try to destroy it: Klopp's message to Russia
222.article_body: Talking about the Champions League final between Liverpool and Real Madrid being moved from Russia's Saint Petersburg to France's Stade de France, Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp said, "I am happy...the game is here for thousands of reasons." "[It]...is exactly the right message that Russia should get: Life goes on even when you try to destroy it."

223.title: Ola driver arrested for molesting 15-year-old girl in Mumbai
223.article_body: The Mumbai Police arrested a 29-year-old Ola cab driver for allegedly molesting a 15-year-old girl and making obscene gestures at her. The accused driver has been identified as Murari Kumar Singh who lives in Goregaon. "He is originally from Bihar. We are also finding out if he has any prior cases against him," the police said.

224.title: UP girl's body found in well with limbs tied 11 days after she went missing
224.article_body: The body of a 16-year-old girl, who went missing 11 days ago, was found in a sack in a well with her hands and legs tied in Uttar Pradesh's Bhadohi, police said. "It seems...someone who knew the girl killed her...threw her body...20 kilometres from her house," police added. This comes after locals detected a foul smell coming from the well.

225.title: Not even Djokovic, Nadal slide as well as Iga Świątek on clay: McEnroe
225.article_body: Ex-world number one tennis player John McEnroe said he has never seen anyone as smooth as world number one Iga Świątek while playing on clay courts. "She's an incredible athlete. I don't think I've ever seen a player and this includes Rafael Nadal and Novak Djokovic...move, slide into their backhand, that far open stance two-hander and the forehand," added McEnroe.

226.title: Rachakonda Police detains 2 inter-state drug peddlers under PD Act
226.article_body: Rachakonda Police on Friday invoked the Preventive Detention (PD) Act against two inter-state drug peddlers. The accused were involved in procuring drugs at cheap rates from Andhra Pradesh and supplying them to Kerala, Maharashtra, Telangana and Karnataka, police said. The two accused, along with eight others, were arrested in December last year while selling ganja in Hyderabad, police said.

227.title: Who'll be held responsible for trauma Aryan Khan suffered?: NCP leader
227.article_body: After NCB gave Shah Rukh Khan's son Aryan Khan a clean chit in cruise drugs case, NCP leader Clyde Crasto tweeted, "Who'll be held responsible for...trauma this young man (Aryan) suffered?" "Many questions arise," he added. Furthermore, NCP chief spokesperson Mahesh Tapase claimed that NCB's decision proved that Maharashtra minister Nawab Malik was right when he called the case fake.

228.title: Communal parties like BJP bigger threat than dynastic politics: HD Kumaraswamy
228.article_body: Ex-Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy criticised PM Narendra Modi's 'Pariwarwaadi politics' remark and said that communal politics is a bigger threat to India as compared to dynastic politics. "The danger to nation is not from dynastic parties, it is posed by communal parties like BJP. Parties raising emotive issues to grab political ground are a real threat to democracy," Kumaraswamy said.

229.title: Party will win at least 25 seats in Bengal in 2024 Lok Sabha polls: BJP
229.article_body: BJP MP Locket Chatterjee said that BJP will win at least 25 parliamentary seats in West Bengal in the 2024 Lok Sabha polls, asserting that the party's support base among the masses is still intact. Criticising those who left BJP in Bengal and joined other parties, Chatterjee said, "Those who are leaving the party are opportunists."

230.title: 2 mountaineers killed, 9 injured in Swiss Alps ice fall
230.article_body: A 40-year-old French woman and a 65-year-old Spanish man were killed and nine other mountaineers were injured by falling blocks of ice in the Alps in southern Switzerland on Friday, police said. Seventeen climbers were in the area when the ice blocks broke off at an altitude of 3,400 metres. Seven rescue helicopters were dispatched to evacuate the climbers.

231.title: Which bowlers have been hit for most sixes in an IPL season?
231.article_body: RCB fast bowler Mohammed Siraj has set the record for conceding the most number of sixes in a season of IPL. Siraj has been hit for 31 sixes in IPL 2022. He is followed by his teammate Wanindu Hasaranga, who conceded 30 sixes in IPL 2022. CSK all-rounder Dwayne Bravo was slammed for 29 sixes in IPL 2018.

232.title: My personal photos, chats are being shared without consent: Ex-Zilingo CEO
232.article_body: Former Zilingo CEO Ankiti Bose on Friday shared an Instagram post about how her private data is being circulated online after she was fired from Zilingo. Ankiti wrote, "My personal photos, chats, documents, records may have...been improperly accessed and circulated without my consent...I've seen versions of them on the internet which are clearly fake…My apps are full of hate messages."

233.title: Switzerland to destroy over 6.2 lakh expired COVID vaccine doses
233.article_body: Switzerland will destroy over 6.2 lakh expired doses of Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine, officials said. "It was consciously accepted that under certain circumstances too much vaccine was procured for Switzerland's needs," a Federal Office of Public Health spokesperson said. Nearly 70% of  Switzerland's population is fully vaccinated against the virus, according to Johns Hopkins University tracker.

234.title: Israeli detective used Indian hackers for Russian oligarchs' jobs: Report
234.article_body: Israeli private investigator Aviram Azari, currently in US custody, used Indian hackers to conduct surveillance operations for Russian oligarchs, court filings showed. Independent journalist Scott Stedman told a US court that Azari worked "on surveillance and cyber-intelligence operations" for the oligarchs. Russia's Oleg Deripaska reportedly employed Azari for a business dispute in Austria.

235.title: Porn movies played on screens at airport in Brazil after apparent hack
235.article_body: Porn movies were played on screens at an airport in Brazil's Rio de Janeiro after an apparent hack. Brazil's airport operator, Infraero, said the monitors were advertising screens run by a private company, not official information displays. "Infraero has taken appropriate legal action and filed a case with the federal police," it said in a statement.

236.title: Anonymous donor gives ₹1.3 crore to cover funeral costs of US school shooting victims
236.article_body: Texas Governor Greg Abbott has said an anonymous donor paid $175,000 (over ₹1.3 crore) for the funerals of the 21 victims of the mass shooting at an elementary school. "No family who is suffering from incalculable heartbreak at this time will have to worry about a single cost with regard to anything concerning this travesty," Abbott said.

237.title: Indian oil firms' dividend worth $125.5 mn stuck in Russia due to sanctions
237.article_body: A dividend amounting to $125.49 million belonging to Indian oil companies is stuck in Russia due to Western sanctions over the Ukraine war, said an Oil India official. A consortium comprising Oil India, Indian Oil Corporation and Bharat Petroleum Corporation own 23.9% of Russia's Vankorneft oil project and 29.9% of the Tass-Yuryakh oilfield in east Siberia.

238.title: Rachakonda Police arrest 22-yr-old youth for harassing man, his fiancee
238.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police arrested a 22-year-old youth for harassing a man and his fiancee on social media. According to police, the accused, identified as J Siddu, wanted to marry the victim's fiancee. In order to call off the marriage, Siddu created fake social media profiles and posted the victim's phone number with derogatory and vulgar messages, police added.

239.title: Over 15,000 nurses of Maha govt hospitals go on indefinite strike from today
239.article_body: Over 15,000 nurses of state-run hospitals have decided to go on indefinite strike from Saturday, Maharashtra State Nurses Association (MSNA) said. They are protesting against the state government's decision to outsource the recruitment of nurses to a private agency. "If the recruitment of nurses is outsourced, they will be vulnerable to exploitation and receive lower remuneration," MSNA added.

240.title: Priyanka shares pic of grandmother reading article about her, says 'Miss you'
240.article_body: Priyanka Chopra took to her Instagram Stories on Saturday to remember her late grandmother on her birth anniversary. She shared an old picture showing her grandmother reading a newspaper that contained an article about the actress. "Happy birthday nani. Miss you always," Priyanka wrote with a heart emoji. Priyanka's maternal grandmother, Madhu Jyotsna Akhouri, passed away in June 2016.

241.title: Sadio Mane to Bayern rumours? I couldn’t care less: Liverpool's Klopp
241.article_body: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp said he couldn't care less about rumours regarding a potential transfer for forward Sadio Mane to Bayern Munich. "It's not the first time that I have had a Bayern rumour come up just before a big match," added Klopp. Liverpool will take on Real Madrid in the Champions League final on May 29, 12:30 am IST.

242.title: Humour has come out better than original: RJ Balaji on Badhaai Ho remake
242.article_body: RJ Balaji, who has co-written and co-directed 'Veetla Vishesham', spoke about the upcoming film, which is the Tamil remake of Ayushmann Khurrana-starrer 'Badhaai Ho'. "We've India's two best actors Sathyaraj sir and Urvashi ma'am playing father and mother," he said, adding, "When these two came on board, it became a...different flavoured film, the humour has come out even better than...original."

243.title: 2 dead after minibus falls into Tawi river in Jammu
243.article_body: Two people were killed after a minibus fell into the Tawi river while crossing the river bridge near Bikram Chowk in Jammu. According to the police, the bus driver lost control of the vehicle and smashed the concrete fence of the bridge before the vehicle fell into the river. Notably, the deceased are yet to be identified, police said.

244.title: 149 butterfly species spotted in gardens across Pune: PMC
244.article_body: According to Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC), 149 butterfly species have been spotted in gardens across the city. An environmentalist said that "a good diversity of butterflies indicates a very good diversity in the...vegetation" as each species depends on specific larval host plants. The Common Jay and Common Map species, which are usually found in jungles, were also spotted, officials said.

245.title: 2 minor sisters drown in village pond in Chhattisgarh's Surguja
245.article_body: Two minor sisters drowned in a village pond in Chhattisgarh's Surguja district, police said. The girls, aged 7 and 8, had reportedly gone to attend a wedding along with their family members on May 26. However, a search was launched after the girls didn't return home, police said, adding that their bodies were found floating in the pond on Friday.

246.title: Buttler breaks Kohli's record for hitting most boundaries in a season in IPL history
246.article_body: RR opener Jos Buttler broke Virat Kohli's record for smashing most boundaries in an IPL season. Buttler has slammed 124 boundaries (78 fours and 45 sixes) in IPL 2022. He overtook Virat Kohli's record of 122 boundaries (83 fours and 38 sixes) scored in IPL 2016. Buttler also equalled Kohli's record of hitting most centuries (four) in an IPL season.

247.title: Saves me from doing bad Hindi films: Sood on doing more South Indian films
247.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood, speaking about why he preferred to do more South Indian films in the last couple of years, said, "South saves me from doing bad Hindi films." "Otherwise there comes a phase when you think you're doing a film just for...sake of being seen in...big film. South helps me from staying away from doing that," Sood added.

248.title: PM Modi is silent on dynasty politics, corruption in BJP: HD Kumaraswamy
248.article_body: Former Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy has criticised PM Narendra Modi for commenting on "dynastic politics". "Modi has been speaking about dynasty rule and corruption, but is maintaining a stoic silence on dynasty politics and corruption in his own party (BJP)," Kumaraswamy alleged. He further alleged that the main goal of PM Modi is to finish the regional political parties.

249.title: Exhume body of third person killed in Hyderpora encounter: J&K HC
249.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir HC has directed Union Territory's administration to exhume the body of Amir Latief Magrey, one of the four suspected militants killed in the Hyderpora encounter in November 2021. It ordered the authorities to hand over Magrey's body to his family for burial. While police had said all four deceased were terrorists, their families had dismissed the claims.

250.title: Saha leaves Bengal team's WhatsApp group, wife says he was hurt by official's remark
250.article_body: Wicketkeeper-batter Wriddhiman Saha has left the WhatsApp group of Bengal Ranji team, with his wife saying he was hurt by CAB's joint-secretary Debabrata Das's remarks. Debabrata had said that Saha has given all sorts of excuses to skip games for the state. Saha recently refused to play for Bengal in the upcoming Ranji knockouts.

251.title: Aryan Khan warned Arbaaz Merchant to not carry drugs on cruise: Chargesheet
251.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan's son Aryan had warned Arbaaz Merchant to not carry drugs on cruise, according to the chargesheet. Merchant has not claimed in any of his statements that the 6gm of charas recovered from his possession was meant for Aryan. Aryan was given clean chit by the NCB in the cruise drugs case.

252.title: Multi-storey building in Noida catches fire after short circuit at ATM kiosk
252.article_body: A multi-storey building was engulfed in fire due to a suspected short circuit at an ATM kiosk located in the building. The four-storey building, which is located in Noida's Bhangel area, has both flats and shops in its complex. However, no casualties were reported and the fire, which broke out at around 10 pm, was brought under control, officials said.

253.title: US must prioritise school security funding over Ukraine aid: Trump
253.article_body: The US should prioritise funding for school security over Ukraine aid, ex-President Donald Trump said, days after 19 students were killed in an elementary school shooting. "If...US has $40 billion to send to Ukraine, we should be able to do whatever it takes to keep our children safe at home," he added. However, Trump rejected calls for tightened gun controls.

254.title: Puppy found with arrow through its neck in US expected to survive; pic surfaces
254.article_body: A four-month-old puppy was found by animal services in US' South Carolina with an arrow through its neck. Officials said that the arrow was nearly as long as the dog's body, adding that the canine is expected to survive. A woman had called 911 early morning on Monday after she heard the puppy "screaming" in pain.

255.title: B'luru NCB busts pan-India drug racket; heroin worth ₹52 cr seized
255.article_body: NCB's Bengaluru Zonal Unit "successfully busted and neutralised" a drug syndicate operating across India based on a single input, the agency said in a statement on Friday. Ten people were arrested and heroin worth over ₹52 crore was seized, it added. The arrests occurred after a woman was apprehended with seven kilograms of heroin at Kempegowda International Airport on Tuesday.

256.title: 4 dead, 2 injured as wall collapses due to cylinder blast in Andhra
256.article_body: At least four people were killed and two others were severely injured after a wall of a house collapsed due to a cylinder blast in Andhra Pradesh's Ananthapuramu, police said. "Due to the impact of the blast, wall of neighbour's residence collapsed...crushed four members to death...severely injured two," police added. The injured were shifted to a hospital for treatment.

257.title: I hope they both move on: Elon Musk on Johnny Depp & Amber Heard's trial
257.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Saturday, while replying to a Twitter user who commented on Amber Heard and Johnny Depp's trial, wrote, "I hope they both move on. At their best, they are each incredible." Musk's comments come after Depp talked about the alleged affair between Heard and Musk in a text message, screenshots of which had also surfaced online.

258.title: Was feeling the pressure midway, got distracted: Buttler on IPL 2022
258.article_body: RR's Jos Buttler said he was under pressure and got distracted midway in IPL 2022. "Some days I have been slow to start with, I wish I was never like that," added Buttler. "Certain times I found it tough," stated Buttler. The opener is IPL 2022's leading run-getter with 824 runs. He scored 106*(60) in the Qualifier 2 against RCB.

259.title: Varun Dhawan urges youngsters to 'Chase the World' with Skybags
259.article_body: Skybags has unveiled its new campaign 'Chase The World' with Varun Dhawan. The ad features fashion-forward bags with bold, colourful, and maximalist designs, the brand revealed. The campaign intends to tap into the desires of an increasing number of youngsters who want to venture out in search of newer experiences. The brand encourages travellers to embrace spontaneity while travelling.

260.title: Send drones there: Owaisi to PM Modi on Chinese infrastructure in Arunachal
260.article_body: Reacting to PM Narendra Modi's remark that he uses drones for surprise inspections, AIMIM's Asaduddin Owaisi said that the PM must send drones to Ladakh and see how China is building a bridge over our Pangong Tso lake. "PM Modi send a drone to Arunachal, where your best friend Xi Bhai has made his colony on Indian soil," Owaisi added.

261.title: Minor fire breaks out at EV firm Ather Energy's Chennai dealership; all staff safe
261.article_body: A minor fire broke out at Ather Energy’s premises in Chennai on Friday. The Bengaluru-based electric two-wheeler manufacturer tweeted that while some property and scooters got affected, all employees were safe. The company said that it was investigating the cause of the fire but cannot confirm if the battery of one of the vehicles was responsible for it.

262.title: How does the latest World Test Championship points table read?
262.article_body: With Sri Lanka defeating Bangladesh 1-0 in the two-match Test series, Sri Lanka are now fourth on the World Test Championship (WTC) points table with 55.56% of points won. Bangladesh are eighth on the table, with 16.67% of points won, while England are placed last with 12.5% of points won. India are third on the points table.

263.title: 30 Assam bureaucrats write to Chief Secy over BJP MLA's threat
263.article_body: As many as 30 bureaucrats of Assam's Cachar district administration have written to Chief Secretary Jishnu Barua  over Lakhipur BJP MLA Kaushik Rai's threat. "We would like to bring to your notice...the incident of gross misbehaviour by MLA towards civil servants," they wrote. Rai allegedly assaulted civil servants engaged in relief duty in Sonai amid floods and called them thieves.

264.title: Du Plessis looked like a better leader than Kohli in IPL 2022: Manjrekar
264.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Sanjay Manjrekar said RCB captain Faf Du Plessis looked like a "better leader" than the team's former captain Virat Kohli in IPL 2022. "Du Plessis is a reliable captain," added Manjrekar. RCB were knocked out of IPL 2022 after a defeat against RR in the Qualifier 2 by seven wickets. RR will take on GT in the final.

265.title: 3 held for blackmailing, extorting money from traffic policemen in Gurugram
265.article_body: Three Delhi residents were held for allegedly trying to blackmail and extort money from two Gurugram traffic policemen. The accused threatened the policemen by claiming to possess a video of the latter allegedly seeking a bribe and demanded ₹3 lakh for not sharing it on social media, police said. Notably, the accused had previously extorted money from several Delhi-based policemen.

266.title: Mangalore University bans hijab in degree colleges after protest
266.article_body: Mangalore University announced on Friday that hijabs will be banned in degree colleges as per Karnataka High Court order after students held a protest. Earlier, the university had let girls wear headscarves matching their uniforms' colours. While headscarves will be allowed on campus, they must be removed before entering buildings on the premises, Vice-Chancellor P Subrahmanya Yadapadithaya said.

267.title: Policemen waited for nearly an hour before killing gunman who shot 19 kids dead in US
267.article_body: Around 20 policemen waited in the hallway for nearly an hour before entering and killing the gunman who shot 19 kids dead at an elementary school in US' Texas, authorities said on Friday. "From the benefit of hindsight where I'm sitting now, of course, it was not the right decision," Steven McCraw, Director of Texas Department of Public Safety, said.

268.title: Lithuanians raise funds to buy drone for Ukraine
268.article_body: Lithuanians have raised some €3 million in three days, out of the €5 million needed, to buy an advanced military drone for Ukraine. "This is the first case in history when ordinary people are raising money to buy something like a Bayraktar...it's unbelievable," Ukraine's ambassador to Lithuania, Beshta Petro, said. The fundraiser was started by Lithuanian internet broadcaster, Laisves TV.

269.title: Punjab govt withdraws security cover of 424 VIPs with immediate effect
269.article_body: Punjab government has withdrawn the security cover of 424 VIPs with immediate effect. They include retired police officers, religious leaders and political leaders. Former Punjab DGP PC Dogra and Majitha MLA Ganieve Kaur are on the list. The concerned police personnel have been directed to report to Special DGP State Armed Police, JRC at Jalandhar Cantt on Saturday.

270.title: Centre to hand over stolen antiquities, idols to Tamil Nadu government
270.article_body: The central government will hand over 10 stolen antiquities to Tamil Nadu government next week, officials said. Out of these, four objects were retrieved from Australia in 2020-2022 and six from US last year. The retrieved items include an idol of Dvārapāla of the Vijayanagar dynasty and a sculpture of Natarāja dating back to 11th-12th century, among others.

271.title: Parents kill daughter over inter-faith relationship in T'gana; held
271.article_body: A couple was arrested for allegedly murdering their 20-year-old daughter over her inter-faith relationship with a Muslim man in Telangana's Adilabad, police said on Friday. Following a missing complaint, police had recently handed over the woman to her parents after she eloped with the man, a sub-inspector said. The couple slit the deceased's throat with a knife, the sub-inspector added.

272.title: 'Fun and Tasty', 'The Same One' among possible new names for McDonald's in Russia
272.article_body: McDonald's in Russia has registered possible new brand names such as ‘Fun and Tasty’, 'The Same One', 'Just Like That' and ‘Open Checkout’ for the firm taking over its restaurants in the country. McDonald's, which owns 84% of its restaurants in Russia, is selling its nearly 850 stores in the country to a local licensee, Alexander Govor.

273.title: Parents have stopped sending me job posts: Panchayat's Sanvikaa
273.article_body: Actress Sanvikaa, who plays the role of Rinki in web series 'Panchayat', has said her parents wanted her to have a stable job. "They used to keep sending me...employment news links and wanted me to apply for them," she added. Sanvikaa further said following the success of 'Panchayat', her parents are very happy and they've stopped sending her job posts.

274.title: Bangalore University to auction 50 jackfruit trees to generate revenue
274.article_body: Ahead of the upcoming jackfruit season, Bangalore University has decided to auction off 50 jackfruit trees on its 1,000-acre Jnanabharathi campus. Last year, the varsity had tried to auction off the trees but did not gain any revenue due to lack of buyers. The auction will take place on May 31 and bidders are required to pay a ₹5,000 deposit.

275.title: Learnt a lot from Sushmita, she raised 2 daughters despite being alone: Charu
275.article_body: Sushmita Sen's sister-in-law Charu Asopa, who welcomed a baby girl in November 2021, has said she has learnt a lot from Sushmita, especially how well she has raised her two daughters "despite being alone". "She makes me believe...woman can do anything in...life," Charu added. She further said Sushmita was inside the operation theatre during the birth of her baby girl.

276.title: Canadian agency probes Tesla fire in which driver struggled to exit
276.article_body: Canadian government's Transport Canada is probing the cause of a Tesla car fire in Vancouver in which the driver struggled to exit the car and ultimately broke its windows. Following the fire, Transport Canada had its contracted collision and defect investigation team "locate and secure the vehicle". The driver had claimed that his car shut down after an error notification.

277.title: UP govt seeks details of patients with fever, rashes amid monkeypox scare
277.article_body: Amid rising monkeypox cases across the world, the UP government has issued an advisory to health officials of the state and District Magistrates directing them to share information about patients suffering from fever and rashes and asked them to remain alert. As per the advisory, the details of such patients are to be submitted to office of Chief Medical Officer.

278.title: Nobody else has batted so well in IPL's history: Sangakkara on Buttler
278.article_body: Discussing RR opener Jos Buttler's performances in IPL 2022, RR's Director of Cricket Kumar Sangakkara said, "I can't remember anyone else batting this well in...[IPL's history]." "[Buttler's] got all the strokes...[and] understands the game really well," added Sangakkara. Buttler has scored 824 runs in IPL 2022 so far. He scored 106* off 60 balls in the Qualifier 2 against RCB.

279.title: Kangana's 'Dhaakad' collects ₹4,420 on Day 8, sells only 20 tickets across India: Report
279.article_body: Kangana Ranaut-starrer 'Dhaakad' collected only ₹4,420 on the eighth day of its release, selling only 20 tickets across the country, a report said. Overall, Dhaakad has made around ₹3 crore so far. 'Dhaakad' reportedly cost between ₹80 crore and ₹90 crore to make. Directed by Razneesh Ghai, the film also stars Arjun Rampal, Divya Dutta and Saswata Chatterjee.

280.title: How did Virat Kohli perform in IPL 2022 as compared to other seasons?
280.article_body: RCB batter Virat Kohli scored 341 runs in IPL 2022, the least amount of runs scored by him in last five seasons. He recorded a strike rate of 115.99, the worst strike rate for him since IPL 2012, when his strike rate read 111.65. His batting average of 22.73 in IPL 2022 is his lowest in last 14 seasons.

281.title: US woman who punched, broke flight attendant's teeth jailed
281.article_body: A US woman who punched a flight attendant in the face, breaking her teeth, has been jailed for 15 months. Vyvianna Quinonez assaulted the attendant after she asked the 29-year-old to buckle her seatbelt, stow her tray table and wear her facemask properly during the flight's final descent. Quinonez was also ordered to pay over $30,000 in fines and restitution.

282.title: 2 dead in separate road accidents in Pune
282.article_body: Two people died while two got injured in two separate road accidents that took place in Pune on Friday. At Kunjirwadi on the Pune-Solapur highway, a speeding container killed a 26-year-old man. Meanwhile, in another incident, a water tanker hit a motorbike near the textile market on the Hadapsar Saswad Road, leading to the death of a 19-year-old boy.

283.title: India reports 2,685 new COVID-19 cases, 2,158 recoveries in last 24 hours
283.article_body: India has reported 2,685 COVID-19 cases, 2,158 recoveries in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 2,710 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in India stand at 16,308, while the death toll has risen to 5,24,572, according to the latest data.

284.title: I guess I have trust issues with Bill Gates: Elon Musk
284.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk remarked, "I guess I have some trust issues" with Bill Gates. A Twitter user wrote that she didn’t trust Gates, to which Musk replied, "Since Gates still has a multi-billion dollar short position against Tesla while claiming to help with global warming, I guess I’ve some trust issues with him too."

285.title: Details of calls made by 2 girls as shooter killed 19 kids at US school released
285.article_body: Officials have released the details of the emergency calls made by two girls as the 18-year-old shooter killed kids at the elementary school in US. The girls called at least half a dozen times from the classrooms asking for police to intervene. Twenty-one people including 19 kids were killed in the mass shooting that took place in Texas' Uvalde.

286.title: 44-yr-old Rajasthan Police constable found hanging from tree in Alwar
286.article_body: A 44-year-old Rajasthan Police head constable, Dhruv Singh Jat, allegedly hanged himself from a tree in Alwar on Friday, police said. He was posted at Udyog Nagar Police Station, police added. Jat left his house on Thursday informing his family that he was going to Jaipur for official work. No suicide note was recovered from the scene, police further said.

287.title: Glenn Maxwell, Mohammed Siraj had a terrible IPL 2022 season: Parthiv
287.article_body: Former India wicketkeeper Parthiv Patel said all-rounder Glenn Maxwell and pacer Mohammed Siraj had a "terrible" IPL 2022 season for RCB. "I was surprised to see RCB retain...Maxwell on the basis of one good season...He has been consistent with his inconsistency," added Parthiv. "He scores big runs after every five seasons," stated Parthiv. Maxwell scored 301 runs in IPL 2022.

288.title: BMC issues ₹5 crore tender for development of Democracy Square
288.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) issued ₹5 crore tender to develop a Democracy Square on the lines of Hutatma Chowk at a traffic island near Azad Maidan junction. The Democracy Square will be spread over 1,000 square metres and will represent the four pillars of democracy. It will have facilities like a viewing gallery, seating space and a selfie point.

289.title: Putin trying to wipe out Ukrainian culture and identity: Biden
289.article_body: US President Joe Biden said Russian President Vladimir Putin is not just trying to take over Ukraine through invasion but is "trying to wipe out" Ukrainian people's identity. Putin is attacking schools,  hospitals and museums "with no other purpose than to eliminate a culture", Biden said. The war is "a direct assault on...fundamental tenets of rule-based international order", he added.

290.title: If Bezos wants to get to orbit, less partying & more work is advisable: Musk
290.article_body: Responding to a Twitter user who asked him if he thought that the world's second-richest man Jeff Bezos was a good person, the world's richest person Elon Musk said, "He’s fine." Musk added, "Does seem like he's spending a lot of time in the hot tub...If he wants to get to orbit, less partying and more work would be advisable."

291.title: RPF busts hawala racket at Kalyan station; over ₹1 cr cash seized
291.article_body: The Railway Protection Force (RPF) of central railway busted a hawala racket at Kalyan station and recovered over ₹1 crore cash and jewellery worth over ₹9 lakh, an official said on Friday. "While conducting preventive checks, RPF team apprehended five courier company employees, who were carrying hawala money," the official added. The money was being transported from Hyderabad to Mumbai.

292.title: Over 21,000 private vehicles fined for bus lane violations in Delhi
292.article_body: Over 21,000 private vehicles have been fined for bus lane violations in Delhi in two months, officials said. As many as 391 DTC buses and 328 cluster buses have also been penalised under the drive that started on April 1. Delhi government has earmarked dedicated lanes for buses and goods carriers from 8 am to 10 pm.

293.title: FDA seals company in Pune, seizes items worth ₹7.73 lakh
293.article_body: Food and Drug Administration (FDA) on Friday sealed a company manufacturing products without a licence in Pune, officials said. The agency also seized raw materials used to make bath and make-up products estimated to be worth about ₹7.73 lakh, officials added. "The seized materials were used to manufacture shampoo, conditioner, beard wash, hair treatment and keratin products," an official said.

294.title: Over 5,330 families living in dangerous buildings in Navi Mumbai: Survey
294.article_body: The Navi Mumbai Municipal Corporation (NMMC) has declared 514 buildings in the city as dangerous. Out of these, 350 are commercial properties, whereas over 5,330 families are residing in 'extremely dangerous' category buildings, according to a survey conducted by the civic body. The NMMC has sent notices to such buildings to evacuate and repair the structures.

295.title: Fan invades pitch and touches Virat Kohli, video goes viral
295.article_body: A video has gone viral showing a fan invading the pitch during RCB and RR's IPL 2022 Qualifier 2 match at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad. The fan appeared to have touched Virat Kohli's glove while he was batting. The fan was then caught by the security and escorted out of the ground.

296.title: 3 boys drown while swimming in Bengaluru lake; 2 bodies recovered
296.article_body: Three boys, aged between 15 and 17, drowned while swimming in the Doddagubbi lake in Bengaluru. An assistant police sub-inspector told Hindustan Times on Friday that two of the three bodies have been recovered so far. A group of five boys had reportedly gone to the lake for a swim a day earlier when the incident took place.

297.title: 1 dead, 2 injured as roof of building collapses in Delhi's Mundka
297.article_body: A 24-year-old labourer died and two others were severely injured after the roof of an under-construction building collapsed in Delhi's Mundka on Friday. Police said they received a call at the control room around 5 pm following which officials rushed to the spot. "The two injured persons are being treated at a private hospital," DCP (Outer Delhi) Sameer Sharma said.

298.title: Indian Army releases names of personnel who died after bus fell into Ladakh river
298.article_body: The Northern Command of the Indian Army has released the names of seven personnel who lost their lives after the bus carrying them skidded off a road and plunged into the Shyok river in Ladakh. The Northern Command wrote, "#LtGenUpendraDwivedi, #ArmyCdrNC and all ranks of #NorthernComd express deepest condolences to the families of the bravehearts who lost their lives."

299.title: Appreciate India's support in this difficult period: Sri Lanka PM
299.article_body: Sri Lankan PM Ranil Wickremesinghe expressed his appreciation for India extending support to his nation during "this difficult period". Wickremesinghe tweeted that he had spoken to Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman and he looked "forward to strengthening ties between" the two nations. He also thanked India and Japan for the move to set up a foreign aid consortium for Sri Lanka.

300.title: 18 more arrested over hate sloganeering at Kerala PFI rally
300.article_body: Police said that 18 more people have been arrested in the case where a video allegedly showed a minor boy raising provocative slogans at a Popular Front of India (PFI) rally in Kerala's Alappuzha. "As of now, we have 20 people under arrest," police added. The purported short video shows the boy sitting on the shoulders of a person.

301.title: Axis MF ex-fund manager fired in front-running case sends legal notice to firm
301.article_body: Viresh Joshi, a former fund manager at Axis Mutual Fund who was fired after being suspended on allegations of front-running, has sent a legal notice to the company against his "unlawful termination". Axis AMC, one of India's leading mutual funds, is facing allegations of front-running. It earlier said it has been conducting a suo moto internal investigation since February 2022.

302.title: Foetus sex detection racket busted in Odisha, 13 arrested
302.article_body: Police said that 13 people including a noted public health activist were arrested after a foetus sex determination racket was busted in Odisha's Berhampur. Police said that the main suspect, Durga Prasad Nayak, who runs the clinic at his residence, was found conducting tests using ultrasound machines. Eleven pregnant women were present at the house during the raid, police added.

303.title: Nothing is normal in J&K: Omar Abdullah after Amreen's killing
303.article_body: After TV artiste Amreen Bhat was shot dead by terrorists in Budgam, former Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah said that "nothing is normal" in the Union Territory. "Areas in and around Srinagar used to be free of militancy. Now incidents are happening one after the other," Omar Abdullah said. "There is no justification for such incidents," he added.

304.title: India responds to OIC criticism on Yasin Malik verdict, says 'don't justify terror'
304.article_body: The government on Friday issued a statement after the Organisation of Islamic Cooperation (OIC) criticised the life imprisonment sentence given to Yasin Malik in a terror funding case. Calling the Islamic nations group's comments "unacceptable", India said, "The world seeks zero tolerance of terrorism and we urge OIC not to justify it in any manner."

305.title: Baby born with 'permanent smile' due to rare condition in Australia, pics surface
305.article_body: A baby named Ayla Summer Mucha was born in December 2021 in Australia with bilateral macrostomia, where the corners of mouth don't fuse together during pregnancy. The rare condition makes it seem as though she has a 'permanent smile'. According to New York Post, a study published in Cleft Palate-Craniofacial Journal in 2007 noted just 14 cases of this condition.

306.title: Man kills his mother with a wooden plank in Odisha, arrested
306.article_body: Police said that a 30-year-old man, identified as Jitendra Kanhar, allegedly killed his mother with a wooden plank in Odisha's Kandhamal district. Police added that Kanhar, who often quarrelled with his 61-year-old mother, hit her with a wooden plank in a fit of rage following an argument. "Kanhar was arrested and an investigation is underway," Phulbani Sub-Divisional Police Officer said.

307.title: India delivers over 25 tonnes of medical supplies to Sri Lanka
307.article_body: India on Friday delivered over 25 tonnes of medical supplies to Sri Lanka as part of its ongoing efforts to provide aid to the country amid an economic crisis. The supplies also include kerosene for use by Sri Lankan fishermen, the High Commission of India in Colombo said. "These supplies will be distributed among the beneficiaries in...coming days," it added.

308.title: Jos Buttler smashes hundred as RR defeat RCB to reach IPL final after 14 years
308.article_body: RR defeated RCB by seven wickets in the Qualifier 2 to reach the final of IPL 2022. RCB put up a total of 157/8, with RR chasing it down in 18.1 overs, driven by Jos Buttler's 106*(60). RR have reached an IPL final after 14 years. They had defeated CSK in the final of the inaugural edition in 2008.

309.title: Isolated high impact accidents: Ola on claims of scooter's front fork failure
309.article_body: Ola Electric has responded after a Twitter user claimed that the front suspension of his Ola S1 Pro scooter broke during low-speed driving. The company said that the recent incidents were caused due to "isolated high impact accidents" and that its scooters undergo rigorous quality assessment. The user had sought "replacement or design change" and claimed Ola used "poor material".

310.title: Woman stabbed by stalker multiple times on busy road in Hyd, attack caught on CCTV
310.article_body: A 48-year-old woman was stabbed multiple times on a busy road in Hyderabad and CCTV footage of the same has emerged. The man who attacked her is her neighbour, who, as per her family, had allegedly been harassing and stalking her. The family said they had earlier filed a police complaint against the man, who was arrested but released later.

311.title: Russia needs huge financial resources for operation in Ukraine: Minister
311.article_body: Russian Finance Minister Anton Siluanov on Friday said that Russia needs huge financial resources for its military operation in Ukraine. The war in Ukraine had prompted the West to impose sanctions on the Russian economy in an effort to discourage Russia from continuing the conflict. The Russian economy has been pushed to the brink of recession, according to Reuters.

312.title: Tesla won't make cars in India if we aren't allowed to sell and service first: Musk
312.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk responded to a Twitter user who asked about Tesla's plans for a manufacturing plant in India and said, "Tesla will not put a manufacturing plant in any location where we aren't allowed first to sell and service cars." Earlier, Union Minister Nitin Gadkari said Tesla is welcome to India, make cars for sale and export them.

313.title: 11 injured, vehicles damaged as 2 families clash over ₹2,100 in MP
313.article_body: Police said that 11 people were injured and 15 motorcycles were damaged after two families clashed over ₹2,100 in Madhya Pradesh's Indore on Thursday night. "One Kishore Chohan along with his eight relatives had a heated argument with Narendra Mundel over ₹2,100," Simrol Police Station Inspector said. Later, Mundel, accompanied by around 90 persons, attacked Chohan's group, he added.

314.title: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh completes sea sortie in submarine
314.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh completed a sea sortie in a submarine on Friday, describing the experience as "wonderful and thrilling". "Spent hours under the sea and witnessed the combat capabilities...of...Kalvari class submarine," he tweeted. "After having the firsthand insight into the under water capabilities of the Indian Navy, I'm more assured of India's security," he said.

315.title: Sincere condolences: Mamata as 7 Army soldiers killed in Ladakh
315.article_body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee condoled the death of seven soldiers who died in a road accident in Ladakh on Friday. "Sincere condolences for the bereaved, solidarity for all," she tweeted. Army officials said that seven soldiers were killed and several others were injured when their vehicle skidded off the road and fell into the Shyok River in Ladakh.

316.title: Uttarakhand govt forms panel to prepare draft on Uniform Civil Code
316.article_body: Uttarakhand government has formed a committee to prepare a draft on the implementation of Uniform Civil Code in the state. The committee, headed by retired Supreme Court Justice Ranjana Desai, will prepare a draft soon and we'll implement the UCC immediately, Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami said. The UCC would be implemented for everybody, irrespective of their religion, he added.

317.title: It's no joke: Varun Dhawan on Pak singer's plagiarism allegation
317.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan has responded to Pakistani singer Abrar Ul Haq's plagiarism allegations against the 'Jug Jugg Jeeyo' song 'Nach Punjaban', saying, "It's no joke. All the processes have been followed." Following Abrar's allegation, music label T-Series released an official statement dismissing the claims, stating that they legally acquired the rights to adapt the song from the original album.

318.title: I'm not satisfied: GT pacer Yash Dayal on his IPL 2022 performance
318.article_body: GT pacer Yash Dayal, who has taken 10 wickets from eight matches in IPL 2022 so far at an economy rate of 9.59, said he's not satisfied with his performance. "I am trying to contribute well with a good economy rate. But sometimes I gave away too many runs," he added. The 24-year-old is playing in his maiden IPL.

319.title: Tesla won't make cars in a location where we can't sell first: Musk on India plans
319.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk responded to a Twitter user who asked about Tesla's plans for a manufacturing plant in India and said, "Tesla will not put a manufacturing plant in any location where we aren't allowed first to sell and service cars." Earlier, Union Minister Nitin Gadkari said Tesla is welcome to India, make cars for sale and export them.

320.title: Calcutta University students protest, demand online exams
320.article_body: Around 200 students of Calcutta University (CU) protested outside the university's main campus at College Street, demanding online examinations. "Classes were held on campus only for two months and we are expected to write papers based on the whole syllabus," a student said. CU Vice-Chancellor said that a decision will be taken after getting opinions from all stakeholders.

321.title: Why is Guj becoming gateway of drugs?: Cong on 52kg drug seizure
321.article_body: After 52 kilograms of cocaine was seized from Gujarat's Mundra Port, Congress' spokesperson Pawan Khera asked, "Why is Gujarat becoming the gateway of drugs in India?" "We're not trying to corner the government…we're trying to protect [India's future generations]," he added. Meanwhile, BJP's spokesperson Tom Vadakkan said, "Drugs are caught in Gujarat because the government is acting strictly."

322.title: MP to hold three-tier panchayat polls from June 25 to July 8
322.article_body: The State Election Commission (SEC) has announced that the three-tier panchayat polls in Madhya Pradesh will be held in three phases. The polling for the first phase will be held on June 25, while the polling for the second and third phases will be conducted on July 1 and July 8, respectively. The nomination process will start from May 30.

323.title: Don't think apology coming from media: Atul on Aryan's clean chit
323.article_body: Fashion photographer and producer Atul Kasbekar has tweeted in support of Shah Rukh Khan's son Aryan Khan after the latter got a clean chit by NCB in the Mumbai cruise drugs case. Atul wrote, "Now that there's a complete clean chit for #AryanKhan...I don't suppose there's an apology...forthcoming from...media channels that were crucifying the kid in this flimsy case?"

324.title: He has marshalled his troops well: Shastri on RCB captain Du Plessis
324.article_body: Ravi Shastri lauded RCB captain Faf du Plessis for tackling the tight situation in the Eliminator against LSG. "They kept their nerves towards their end. I thought Faf's calmness was brilliant...he was very good with the way he marshalled his troops," he stated. "Just his influence on the game to back the calmness was good to see," added Shastri.

325.title: Which countries have reported monkeypox cases so far?
325.article_body: Over 200 monkeypox cases have been reported in at least 21 countries with Finland confirming its first case on Friday. Australia, Austria, Belgium, Czech Republic, Denmark, France, Germany, Italy, the Netherlands, Portugal, Slovenia and Spain are among the affected nations. Sweden, Switzerland, the UK, the US, Canada, Israel, UAE and Argentina have also reported cases of the virus.

326.title: People steal gram sacks from truck after accident in Chhattisgarh
326.article_body: Following a collision between two trucks in Chhattisgarh's Bilaspur on Friday, several people were  allegedly seen stealing sacks from one of the trucks in a video that has surfaced online. The truck was loaded with 'chana' (gram). "A case of theft and accident has been registered. The stolen material will be recovered soon," Bilaspur ASP Umesh Kashyap said.

327.title: Indians would've killed him with trolling: Aly Goni on Depp-Heard case
327.article_body: Television actor Aly Goni took to Instagram Stories on Friday to share a video of fans cheering for Johnny Depp outside the courthouse amid his ongoing defamation trial against ex-wife Amber Heard. Aly wrote alongside the video, "It's a good thing that it didn't happen in India otherwise people would have killed him with trolling because of this. #MardBhiInsaanHai #JohnnyDepp."

328.title: I know I don't have anyone to fall back on: Manushi Chhillar
328.article_body: Actress Manushi Chhillar, who will make her Bollywood debut in Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Samrat Prithviraj', has stated that she knows she doesn't have anyone to fall back on. "I was clear in my head about one thing that if people were to give me work, it would purely be because they want to work with me," the actress added.

329.title: 5,500-year-old tree believed to be world's oldest found in Chile, pics released
329.article_body: A tree that is up to 5,484 years old has been found in a forest in southern Chile and it is believed to be the world's oldest tree, as per a new study. The age of the ancient alerce tree known as "great grandfather" beats the current record-holder, which is a 4,853-year-old bristlecone pine tree in California.

330.title: Monkeypox can be contained if we act now, says WHO
330.article_body: Speaking about the monkeypox outbreaks globally, a World Health Organization (WHO) official on Friday said, "We think that if we put in place...right measures now we probably can contain this easily." Early detection and isolation of cases and contact tracing are needed, the official added. The official also called on countries to share data about their vaccine stockpiles.

331.title: Knock out by dad: Dhawan as father jokingly beats him after PBKS exit IPL 2022
331.article_body: After his team Punjab Kings (PBKS) failed to qualify for the Indian Premier League (IPL) 2022 playoffs, Shikhar Dhawan shared a video on Instagram. In the video, Dhawan can be seen being playfully beaten by his father while others try to stop him. "Knock out by my dad for not qualifying for knockouts," Dhawan jokingly captioned the video.

332.title: Truth prevails: Pooja Bhatt on Aryan Khan's clean chit in drugs case
332.article_body: Actress-filmmaker Pooja Bhatt has reacted to Shah Rukh Khan's son Aryan getting a clean chit by NCB in the Mumbai cruise drugs case, tweeting, "#truthprevails." She further wrote, "Sameer [Wankhede]...Probably very busy being a righteous,publicity shy officer elsewhere...And who better than the least corrupt of them all to cure society of all evil & rot. Except this time,no selfies allowed."

333.title: 5,000 Ukrainian prisoners held in breakaway region: Separatist leader
333.article_body: More than 5,000 Ukrainian prisoners of war were being held in the self-proclaimed Donetsk People's Republic, according to a separatist leader in eastern Ukraine. Russia had recognised Donetsk as an independent republic days before it launched the invasion of Ukraine. Notably, there have been a few instances of exchange of prisoners between Russia and Ukraine amid the war.

334.title: It exposed inefficiency, recklessness of NCB: RGV on Aryan's clean chit
334.article_body: Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma took to Twitter to react to Shah Rukh Khan's son Aryan Khan getting a clean chit by NCB in the Mumbai cruise drugs case. He wrote, "The...good thing which came about...is him being a celebrity's son. It helped in...exposing the inefficiency and recklessness of...agencies subjecting innocent people to harassment which otherwise...people can't and won't know of."

335.title: This is for Sri Lankans: Karunarathna on SL's 1-0 Test series win vs B'desh
335.article_body: Following Sri Lanka's 1-0 Test series win against Bangladesh, Sri Lanka skipper Dimuth Karunarathna took to Twitter and wrote, "I would like to dedicate the win to all Sri Lankans." He added, "We are having a tough time there. This win brings some joy to their faces." Notably, Sri Lanka is currently experiencing its worst economic crisis in history.

336.title: Venkatesh told me last season, 'Patidar is a brilliant player': Harbhajan
336.article_body: Talking about Rajat Patidar, Harbhajan Singh said Venkatesh Iyer had told him about the RCB batter during IPL 2021. "He told me, 'He's a brilliant player...can single-handedly win the match for his team'...that innings[112*], against LSG, showed that the player has a lot of capability," he added. Patidar was picked as a replacement for injured Luvnith Sisodia in IPL 2022.

337.title: AAP's free electricity offer troubling Gujarat BJP chief: Kejriwal
337.article_body: AAP chief and Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Friday took to Twitter and asked why his offer to provide free electricity to the people of Gujarat was "troubling" state BJP chief CR Patil. "There is huge corruption in Gujarat government," Kejriwal added. His remarks come after Patil recently cautioned people against getting influenced by freebies offered by "some political leaders".

338.title: IAS officer wades through mud to inspect flood-hit areas in Assam, pics go viral
338.article_body: Pictures of an IAS officer visiting flood-affected areas in Assam's Cachar have gone viral on Twitter, with many users and civil servants praising her efforts. Cachar district's Deputy Commissioner Keerthi Jalli is seen wading through mud to interact with locals to understand their problems. Locals reportedly said this was the first time a Deputy Commissioner visited them.

339.title: NHRC notice to Maha as 4 kids test HIV +ve after blood transfusion
339.article_body: The National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) has taken suo motu cognisance of a media report which stated that four thalassemic children tested HIV positive in Maharashtra's Nagpur allegedly after blood transfusions and one of them died. The NHRC has issued a notice to the state Chief Secretary, calling for a detailed report in the matter within six weeks.

340.title: Nykaa's Q4 net profit falls 49% to ₹8.56 crore, revenue rises to ₹973 crore
340.article_body: Beauty e-commerce startup Nykaa's parent FSN E-Commerce Ventures Ltd reported that the net profit attributable to its shareholders dropped 49% year-on-year to ₹8.56 crore in the quarter ended March. While the company's revenue from operations rose 31% year-on-year to ₹973 crore, its expenses rose to about ₹979 crore from ₹725 crore a year earlier.

341.title: 'Prithviraj' renamed to 'Samrat Prithviraj' over Karni Sena's demand
341.article_body: The makers of Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Prithviraj' have renamed the film to 'Samrat Prithviraj' following the demand from Karni Sena. A letter penned by YRF CEO addressed to Karni Sena's National, Youth and State Presidents has surfaced. It reads, "We are highly appreciative of the mutual agreement reached between us that you have no further objections with regards to our Film."

342.title: Anguished: PM Modi on death of 7 soldiers in Ladakh accident
342.article_body: PM Narendra Modi expressed his condolences over the death of seven Indian Army soldiers in a road accident in Ladakh. PM said he's anguished by the loss of the army personnel, adding, "My thoughts are with...bereaved families." The accident occurred in Ladakh's Turtuk village when the vehicle in which the soldiers were travelling fell into the Shyok river, reports said.

343.title: No monkeypox cases in India yet, no need to panic: ICMR scientist
343.article_body: A scientist of the Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) advised people not to panic over monkeypox, adding, "In India, we haven't had any case yet." "We are having cases in non-endemic countries of Europe and the USA," ICMR scientist Dr Aparna Mukherjee said. The government is keeping a watch, she added.

344.title: Ex-Tripura MLA Ashish Das quits TMC, says 'can't survive in TMC'
344.article_body: Former Tripura MLA Ashish Das on Friday quit the Trinamool Congress (TMC), stating that "it's no longer possible for him to survive in the party". He said that the TMC leadership "doesn't give due respect" to its leaders, adding, "They (party leadership) don't even consider us human beings." Das had quit the BJP to join the TMC in October 2021.

345.title: J&K's situation deteriorating: Mufti after meeting Amreen's family
345.article_body: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti met the family members of TV artiste Amreen Bhat, who was killed by terrorists in Budgam and said "situation is deteriorating" in the valley. "Innocent people are being killed every day," Mufti said. Criticising the Centre, she said, "Government keeps blowing its trumpet of normalcy in Jammu and Kashmir even when such gruesome incidents suggest otherwise."

346.title: 1st transgender Barbie designed after actress Laverne Cox, pic released
346.article_body: Laverne Cox has made history by becoming Mattel's first-ever transgender Barbie. The actress and LGBTQ rights-advocate got this recognition just a few days before her 50th birthday later this week. The company described Cox as "a four-time Emmy-nominated actress, Emmy-winning producer, and the first transgender woman of colour to have a leading role on a scripted TV show".

347.title: Argentina reports Latin America's 1st confirmed monkeypox case: AP
347.article_body: Argentina on Friday reported Latin America's first confirmed case of monkeypox in a resident of Buenos Aires province, according to The Associated Press. The man had travelled to Spain recently, according to authorities. Notably, nearly 200 cases of monkeypox have been reported in more than 20 countries so far, the World Health Organization (WHO) said.

348.title: 'Was filmed without consent by coach's trainee', says gymnast Reddy; probe launched
348.article_body: Gymnast Aruna Budda Reddy has alleged that she was videographed without her consent during a physical fitness test in March, by a trainee of coach Rohit Jaiswal. The Sports Authority of India (SAI) has formed a three-member inquiry committee to look into the allegations.
