Reddy had threatened legal action after Jaiswal got a clean chit from Gymnastics Federation of India.

349.title: Deeply saddened: Rajnath on death of 7 soldiers in Ladakh accident
349.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Friday said he was "deeply saddened" by the loss of lives of seven Indian Army soldiers due to an accident in Ladakh's Turtuk village. "We will never forget their exemplary service to our nation," he added. "My condolences to the bereaved families and prayers for the speedy recovery of the injured," the minister further said.

350.title: Dismissed Punjab Health Minister sent to 14-day judicial custody
350.article_body: A Mohali court has sent former Punjab Health Minister Vijay Singla to 14-day judicial custody till June 10. Vijay was arrested by the Anti-Corruption Branch after Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann dismissed him from the state Cabinet over alleged corruption charges. Singla was allegedly demanding a 1% commission from officials for contracts, CM Mann's office had said.

351.title: I feel like my baby was taken away from me: Bose on being fired as Zilingo CEO
351.article_body: Ankiti Bose, the Co-founder of Singapore-based Zilingo who was fired as CEO last week, said, "I feel like my baby has been taken away from me without giving me a proper explanation or a chance to fight for her back." Bose told Bloomberg she's "grieving and fighting" for herself simultaneously. Bose, who was fired for "serious financial irregularities", denied wrongdoing.

352.title: 4 killed, 7 injured as auto-rickshaw overturns in Andhra's Krishna
352.article_body: Police said that four people were killed and seven others were injured when the auto-rickshaw they were travelling in overturned while trying to overtake another vehicle in Andhra Pradesh's Krishna district. Avanigadda DSP Mahaboob Basha said that 20 people were travelling in the auto-rickshaw at the time of the accident. Three women and a man died on the spot.

353.title: Boney Kapoor's credit card fraudulently used for transactions worth ₹3.82 lakh
353.article_body: An aide of producer Boney Kapoor has filed a complaint against an unidentified person after the latter's credit card was fraudulently used to carry out transactions totalling ₹3.82 lakh. The accused has used the credit card to carry out five online transactions. Kapoor found out about it when an executive from his bank called up for credit card bill payment.

354.title: Things are falling in place for RCB: Manjrekar ahead of Qualifier 2
354.article_body: On being asked why he predicted RCB would win Qualifier 2 against RR in IPL 2022, Sanjay Manjrekar said things are falling in place for Faf du Plessis-led side. "They have class bowlers, they performed well in the last match where Mohammed Siraj took a crucial wicket," he added. Manjrekar further said that Harshal Patel is the team's trump card.

355.title: Delhi approves ₹16 crore-project for strengthening 12 city roads
355.article_body: The Delhi government has approved a project worth ₹16.03 crore for strengthening 12 key roads in the capital, including the stretch in front of the Akshardham Temple that connects Delhi with Noida. Public Works Department (PWD) officials said these 12 stretches will be overhauled in a way that the area is also decongested. Potholes will also be filled, officials added.

356.title: ED attaches Pune firm's assets worth ₹62.7 cr in bank fraud case
356.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has issued an order to attach assets worth ₹62.7 crore belonging to a Pune-based firm over its alleged involvement in a bank fraud case. The investigation was launched in 2020 after the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) and the Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB), Pune wing registered an FIR. The fraud was committed at the Andhra Bank.

357.title: RR to bowl first against RCB in IPL 2022 Qualifier 2, playing XIs announced
357.article_body: Rajasthan Royals (RR) captain Sanju Samson won the toss and elected to bowl first against Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) in the Qualifier 2 at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad on Friday. Both the teams are fielding an unchanged side. The winner of the Qualifier 2 will face Gujarat Titans (GT) in the final on Sunday.

358.title: Pune civic body's Fire Dept received 482 calls in April and May
358.article_body: The Fire Department of Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has received 482 calls in April and May this year. "The main reason for the rise in the number of incidents of fire in the city is the rise in temperature," the department's Assistant Divisional Officer said. Last year, the department reported 313 cases in April and May.

359.title: I've a gut feeling RCB will go all the way: Harbhajan ahead of RCB-RR
359.article_body: Ahead of Qualifier 2 between RCB and RR in IPL 2022, Harbhajan Singh said, "I've a gut feeling that RCB will go all the way this season. And if they do, they'll probably lift the cup." He added that current RCB team has very good players, who can win the trophy for them. Match will be played in Ahmedabad today.

360.title: Brand accused of copying artwork used in Aishwarya Rai Bachchan's Cannes outfit
360.article_body: A Kolkata-based brand Bobo Calcutta has been accused of plagiarising the artwork that was embroidered on a jacket worn by Aishwarya Rai Bachchan at Cannes this year. Bengaluru-based artist Nidhi Jacob has accused the ready-to-wear label of copying her artwork without paying her. She also noted that the brand even copied her choice of colours.

361.title: Sri Lanka beat Bangladesh by 10 wickets in 2nd Test, win series 1-0
361.article_body: Sri Lanka beat hosts Bangladesh by 10 wickets in second Test in Dhaka on Friday to win the two match series 1-0. After Sri Lanka took a first-innings lead of 141, they bowled out Bangladesh for 169 in their second innings. The visitors chased the 29-run target in three overs. Fast bowler Asitha Fernando took 10 wickets in the match.

362.title: We've decided to work together: Kejriwal on meeting Delhi's new LG
362.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Friday met the newly-appointed Lieutenant Governor of Delhi Vinai Kumar Saxena. Informing about the same, Kejriwal said, "We discussed several issues and decided to work together for...betterment of...[Delhi's people]." Saxena, who took oath as the 22nd Lt Governor of Delhi on Thursday, had said that he'll work as a "local guardian" in the national capital.

363.title: Indian peacekeepers thwart attack by rebel group in DR Congo
363.article_body: UN peacekeepers from India and other nations have thwarted an attack by a rebel group in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC), a senior UN official said. The M23 group has been active in the last couple of weeks in eastern DRC, the official added. The UN is following the situation very closely, the official further said.

364.title: 9-year-old girl dies as houseboat catches fire in J&K's Dal Lake
364.article_body: A nine-year-old girl was charred to death after a houseboat in Dal Lake in Jammu and Kashmir's Srinagar caught fire on Friday, officials said. According to officials, fire tenders were rushed to the spot to douse the fire soon after getting information. An investigation is underway to determine the exact cause of the fire.

365.title: Man arrested for selling narcotics in B'luru, 90 grams MDMA seized
365.article_body: Bengaluru City Police have arrested a person who was allegedly involved in the sale of narcotics, the city's Deputy Commissioner of Police (West Division) Sanjeev M Patil said. Police have recovered 90 grams MDMA, 33 grams brown sugar, 300 grams opium and a two-wheeler from his possession, he added. Patil has also shared a picture of the seized items.

366.title: I'd be lucky: Samantha to troll who said she will die alone
366.article_body: Actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu has responded to a social media user who trolled her by writing in a now-deleted tweet, "She's gonna end up dying alone with cats and dogs." The actress replied, "I would consider myself lucky." Samantha had announced her split from husband actor Naga Chaitanya in October 2021 ahead of their fourth wedding anniversary.

367.title: Ex-Maha minister Deshmukh complains of chest pain, admitted to ICU
367.article_body: Former Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh has been admitted to ICU at Mumbai's KEM Hospital on Friday after he complained of chest pain, high blood pressure and shoulder pain. According to officials, Deshmukh will undergo a stress test shortly. As per an official statement released by the hospital, his condition is being monitored closely.

368.title: So damn uncool to fat shame: Malaika on Amrita getting trolled
368.article_body: Actress Malaika Arora has shared her sister Amrita Arora's Instagram story on receiving "hate" over her weight gain. Malaika wrote, "You say it sis... [You're] beautiful [just] the way you are... [And] guys it's so damn uncool to fat shame anyone... Tch Tch." Amrita also reacted to trolls calling her "old", writing, "So buddhi is meant to be an insult??"

369.title: Ex-Twitter India head steps down as CEO of his edtech startup Invact Metaversity
369.article_body: Invact Metaversity on Friday said its Co-founder Manish Maheshwari is stepping down as CEO and Director. Former Twitter India head Maheshwari and Co-founder Tanay Pratap "had diverging visions" for the edtech startup's long-term prospects, Invact said. "It's heartbreaking for a founder to leave the startup, like a mother leaving her baby. I'm going through the same emotion," Maheshwari tweeted.

370.title: 16th seeds Bopanna-Middelkoop enter French Open pre-quarterfinals
370.article_body: India's Rohan Bopanna and his Dutch partner Matwe Middelkoop entered the men's doubles pre-quarterfinals at French Open. They defeated Andrey Golubev and Fabrice Martin 6-3, 6-4 in second round on Thursday. The Indo-Dutch duo, seeded 16th, will now face second seeds Nikola Mektic and Mate Pavic. Meanwhile, Indo-American pair of Ramkumar Ramanathan and Hunter Reese lost in the second round.

371.title: Dunzo Daily disrupts the grocery delivery market: Dunzo
371.article_body: Freshness is the need of the hour, and Dunzo Daily is delivering the freshest fruits, vegetables, dairy, meat, and daily provisions to your doorstep in 19 min with up to 50% off and free home delivery, Dunzo announced. Choose from a wide range of top quality products and groceries the smart way with Dunzo Daily, they added.

372.title: Share of ₹2,000 notes in circulation falls as RBI prints no new notes for 3rd year
372.article_body: The share of India's highest denomination currency note in circulation is continuing to drop as the RBI has not printed any new ₹2,000 note since 2019-20, according to the central bank's annual report for 2021-22. As of March 31, there were 214 crore notes of ₹2,000 denomination in circulation, compared with 245 crore notes a year ago, the report showed.

373.title: 4 suspects arrested in Tamil Nadu BJP functionary's murder case
373.article_body: The Greater Chennai Police has arrested four people in connection with the murder of 33-year-old Tamil Nadu BJP SC Wing's District Secretary (Chennai Central) Balachander in Chintadripet. The deceased had seven criminal cases, including two related to attempt to murder, against him. He was provided with an armed guard by police after he complained of threat to his life.

374.title: Is 'buddhi' meant to be an insult: Amrita Arora on being age-shamed over latest pic
374.article_body: Actress Amrita Arora has reacted to social media users, who body-shamed her and called her "old" in the comments section of her latest post. Amrita wrote, "So buddhi is meant to be an insult??...For me it's just a word...that means old?" "Also got...lot of hate on my weight gain! I own it...I love it...my weight my problem!" she added.

375.title: 50% dip in kidney transplants after Ruby Hall case: Pune doctors
375.article_body: Pune city doctors have said that there has been at least a 50% decline in the number of live kidney transplants in the city. This comes after a case related to alleged malpractices in a kidney transplant procedure at Ruby Hall Clinic was reported in Pune. So far, police have arrested two persons in connection with the kidney transplant case.

376.title: Certain types of films don't define your place in industry anymore: Yami
376.article_body: Actress Yami Gautam, in a recent interview, said the industry is now heading in a positive direction. There isn't that notion anymore that certain types of films will define an actor's place in the industry, Yami said, adding that the audience is extremely welcoming. "Even the industry is now opening up to the idea that everybody can co-exist," she added.

377.title: Didn't have any daily soap to do: Rubina Dilaik on doing 'Khatron...'
377.article_body: TV actress Rubina Dilaik said she is doing 'Khatron Ke Khiladi 12' as she didn't have any daily soap to do at present. Further, while talking about her show 'Shakti', she added that she would always prefer quality over quantity. "Weather I...sit at home or wait, I'll only pick...projects that I can contribute to with my full heart," Rubina said.

378.title: I only did 'Kaabil' because it starred Hrithik Roshan: Yami Gautam
378.article_body: Actress Yami Gautam has stated that she had been told to "work with only certain names", adding she did Hrithik Roshan-starrer 'Kaabil' because of this advice. The actress added that she did it but it didn't work for her. Yami further said that she had a very good role in the film but people said she had "very less role".

379.title: One of those innings that'll last a long time: Faf on Patidar's 112*(54)
379.article_body: Praising Rajat Patidar for his unbeaten 112 off 54 balls in Eliminator against LSG in IPL 2022,  RCB captain Faf du Plessis said his teammate's innings was remarkable. "Just one of those innings that will last a very long time. We were all just in awe watching him," he added. RCB defeated LSG by 14 runs at Eden Gardens.

380.title: Terminally-ill British man gets ‘world’s first’ double hand transplant
380.article_body: Steven Gallagher (48) from Scotland, who suffers from scleroderma, an autoimmune disease that causes scarring of skin and internal organs, got a double hand transplant. The 12-hour operation took place in December 2021 after a suitable donor was found. According to hospital, it's first time in the world that hands of a person terminally affected by scleroderma have been replaced.

381.title: Hyderabad man jailed for 5 days for stalking, harassing woman
381.article_body: A local court in Hyderabad sentenced a 36-year-old man, J Nagesh, to five days imprisonment for stalking and harassing a woman. Police said Nagesh initially catcalled the woman and then started harassing her in the guise of introducing her to weight reduction techniques. Following her complaint, the She Team and the local police identified Nagesh using his bike registration number.

382.title: RBI includes 'work from anywhere' policy for staff in its agenda for 2022-23
382.article_body: The RBI in its annual report that was released on Friday stated "working from anywhere" under its agenda for 2022-2023. While it had operationalised work from home during COVID-19, the annual report further stated, "The roadmap for the year would include…To devise a policy on 'working from anywhere' for building a seamless work environment as part of business continuity planning."

383.title: Yoga Utsav held in Hyd to mark 25-day countdown to Int'l Yoga Day
383.article_body: Over 10,000 people in Hyderabad joined the Yoga Utsav to mark the 25-day countdown to International Yoga Day. The event was organised by the Ministry of Ayush with the support of the Telangana government. The event was held under the theme 'Make Yoga a part of your life', and many politicians and celebrities attended the event.

384.title: Some edtech startups weren't mature: Screwvala on recent layoffs
384.article_body: Ronnie Screwvala, upGrad Chairperson, in an interview discussing funding winter in the startup ecosystem and the recent layoffs by some edtech startups, said one or two firms in the edtech space didn't have the maturity to anticipate challenges. His statements follow the recent layoffs by Vedantu and Unacademy. "Startups, VCs were in La La Land," Screwvala added.

385.title: 52 kgs of cocaine worth ₹500 crore seized at Gujarat's Mundra Port
385.article_body: The Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) has seized 52 kilograms of cocaine worth around ₹500 crore, hidden in a consignment of salt shipped from Iran, at Mundra Port in Gujarat's Kutch. After a three-day-long investigation under 'Operation Namkeen', some of the 1,000 bags officials examined were found to be suspicious, as a substance having distinct smell was found in them.

386.title: KL Rahul's 6-hitting ability is more than Kieron Pollard: Harbhajan
386.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Harbhajan Singh said LSG captain KL Rahul often plays the role of an anchor, but his 'six-hitting' ability is more than MI all-rounder Kieron Pollard. Discussing LSG's loss against RCB by 14 runs in IPL 2022's Eliminator, Harbhajan stated, "Lucknow played [slowly] in the initial six overs...[and] missed a trick by not scoring more runs in the powerplay."

387.title: Aim is to take wicket when team needs me: Arshdeep on T20Is vs SA
387.article_body: PBKS pacer Arshdeep Singh, who was selected in India's 18-member squad for five-match T20I series against South Africa, said his aim is to take a wicket whenever the team needs him in series. "Waiting for my debut," he added. Arshdeep's death-overs economy rate of 7.58 is only behind Jasprit Bumrah(7.38) for bowlers with at least eight overs in IPL 2022.

388.title: Taliban dismiss UNSC's call to reverse restrictions on Afghan women
388.article_body: The Taliban has rejected the UN Security Council's call to reverse "practices which are currently restricting the human rights and fundamental freedoms of Afghan women and girls". The Security Council's concerns are "unfounded", the Taliban government said. Earlier this month, the Taliban ordered women to cover their faces in public and asked them not to leave their homes unless necessary.

389.title: Wimbledon to drop titles 'Miss', 'Mrs' on its honours board: Report
389.article_body: Wimbledon has reportedly decided to drop the titles "Miss" and "Mrs" before the names of the female players on its honours board. The move has been aimed in an attempt to modernise the tournament. Notably, no titles are used against the names of the male players on the All England Lawn Tennis Club's honours board.

390.title: Sanjay Raut declares assets worth ₹21.14 crore ahead of Rajya Sabha polls
390.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut declared assets worth ₹21.14 crore while filing his nomination for the Rajya Sabha polls. Raut has ₹1,55,872 in cash and ₹1,93,55,809 as bank deposits, his election affidavit stated. He further owns one vehicle purchased in 2004, two revolvers and three parcels of agricultural land in Alibaug. Also, Raut's wife owns a 0.73-acre plot in Palghar.

391.title: MBBS degree holder cheated of ₹52 lakh in Gurugram; 5 booked
391.article_body: A Gurugram-based MBBS degree holder was allegedly cheated of ₹52 lakh on the pretext of getting a seat in a PG course, police said. The accused had reportedly promised him that they would help him in getting the seat under the management quota at a private medical college in West Bengal. Meanwhile, police have booked five people in the case.

392.title: Do not exaggerate Chinese threat: Beijing to US
392.article_body: China asked the US to not "spread misinformation" and "exaggerate the China threat" to restrain the Asian country's development. This comes after US State Secretary Antony Blinken said China poses the "most serious long-term challenge" to the international order. "China has always been, is and will be the defender of the international order," Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesperson Wang Wenbin said.

393.title: His warmth touched my heart: Anupam on pic with Big Bang Theory's Kunal
393.article_body: Anupam Kher took to Instagram to share a picture of himself with 'The Big Bang Theory' actor Kunal Nayyar. "It was...wonderful to meet Kunal Nayyar...Our very own Delhi Boy...His warmth touched my heart," he wrote. Reacting to the picture, a fan wrote, "It'll be fun to see you two working together," while another fan wrote, "The crossover we never expected."

394.title: Chupke Chupke an iconic film, don't want to ruin its legacy: Bhushan on remake
394.article_body: Bhushan Kumar, who had announced a remake of the 1975 film 'Chupke Chupke', has said remaking a classic is a big responsibility. "We're being very careful...It's an iconic film and we don't want to ruin the legacy," he added. The remake will be written by Luv Ranjan, who has penned films like 'De De Pyaar De' and 'Pyaar Ka Punchnama'.

395.title: Kartik's fans dance to Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2 song in theatre, actor shares video
395.article_body: Kartik Aaryan took to his Instagram Stories to share a video showing his fans dancing to the title track of 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' in a theatre. In the video, two women could be seen matching Kartik's steps when the song is played in the theatre along with the end credits. "Killed it," Kartik wrote while sharing the video.

396.title: Goa pastor, wife arrested for luring people to convert to Christianity
396.article_body: Police arrested Pastor Domnic D'Souza and his wife Joan on Thursday for allegedly luring people to convert to Christianity by offering them cash or promising to cure them of long-term illnesses in Goa. "They're booked for promoting enmity between different groups on grounds of religion and for indulging in deliberate...malicious acts intended to outrage religious feelings," police said.

397.title: China, Russia veto UN sanctions on N Korea over missile launches
397.article_body: China and Russia have vetoed a UN resolution sponsored by the US to impose more sanctions on North Korea over its renewed ballistic missile launches. The remaining 13 council members, including India, had voted in favour of the US-drafted resolution. After the vote on the resolution, Russia and China called for talks between North Korea and the US.

398.title: 7 Army soldiers killed, many hurt as vehicle falls into river in Ladakh: Reports
398.article_body: At least seven Army soldiers were killed in Ladakh's Turtuk village on Friday as the vehicle they were travelling in, skidded off the road and fell into the Shyok river, reports said. Many others have reportedly been grievously injured. The incident took place at around 9 am and there were 26 soldiers in the vehicle, reports added.

399.title: PM Modi flies B'luru-based startup's drone at Drone Mahotsav, video surfaces
399.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Friday flew a drone made by Bengaluru-based startup Asteria Aeronautics Limited at the Bharat Drone Mahotsav in Delhi. The drone PM Modi flew is meant for security and surveillance across different industry sectors. The Bharat Drone Mahotsav 2022 is a two-day event with over 70 exhibitors displaying various use cases of drones.

400.title: Himachal approves 50% bus fare concession for women passengers
400.article_body: The Himachal Pradesh Cabinet has decided to provide 50% concession in fares to women passengers of Himachal Road Transport Corporation (HRTC) intra-state buses. The Cabinet will provide government guarantee in favour of HRTC for raising term loan of ₹160 crore to buy 360 buses and other vehicles. It'll also provide free domestic water supply to rural areas from May 1.

401.title: Asia's richest man's Adani Enterprises to buy 50% stake in General Aeronautics
401.article_body: Asia's richest man Gautam Adani's Adani Enterprises on Friday announced that it has signed a definitive agreement to acquire 50% stake in General Aeronautics Private Limited. The Bengaluru-based company provides robotic drones and drone-based solutions for crop protection. The company didn't disclose the financial details of the deal. The deal is expected to close by July 31, 2022.
